В ходе размышлений о лучших играх 2024 года мне в голову приходят два варианта: Helldivers 2 и Space Marine 2. И там, и там суперсолдаты будущего истребляют гигантских жуков из далёкого космоса, но Sony опять подтвердила звание «конторы», поэтому сегодня я пишу лишь о Space Marine 2 как об игре года.

Игра старомодна. Она сделана по формуле из нулевых: каждый уважающий себя блокбастер должен иметь кампанию часов на десять, мультиплеер и кооператив. Но именно потому, что сейчас таких игр не делают, она ощущается глотком свежего воздуха. Ещё и не имела даже на старте проблем с багами и техническим состоянием.

выветривается из головы сразу после прохождения, но я точно помню, что проходил её буквально с открытым ртом. Это самый достоверный на данный момент Warhammer. Знакомые по книгам сооружения планетарного масштаба и бесчисленные орды врагов здесь есть и сделаны они с максимальным масштабом и детализацией. Поэтому мой космодесантник долгое время не бежал навстречу целям миссий, а кропотливо изучал каждый метр ульев.

явно не создавался как основной режим. Но подобно старым частям Call of Duty позволяет просто весело побегать-пострелять. Короткие матчи, маленькие карты, мгновенные возрождения, забавные фразочки, награды за каждое действие. Старая добрая классика времен игр в джевеле за сотку.

заставит попотеть. Путь к максимальному 25 уровню представляет тяжёлый подъём к вершине. Ты получаешь по лицу, поднимаешься, поднимаешь уровни оружия и класса, учишься играть и начинаешь чувствовать себя увереннее на этом уровне сложности. Потом переходишь на следующий уровень и… уже в самом начале миссии игра ставит тебя на место. Ты снова никто, иди учись играть. Рано или поздно ты доходишь до последнего, пятого уровня сложности, который станет сложнейшим испытанием твоих навыков. Может быть ты так и не осилишь его, но к тому времени хотя бы прокачаешь оружие и навыки.
А потом оказывается, что ты прокачал только один класс и один комплект оружия. Все остальные нужно качать точно так же с нуля. А в игре только 6 (после обновления 7) миссий. Проходить их нужно раз за разом. Знаете, что такое безумие? В этом режиме слишком медленная прогрессия.

В общем, я рекомендую попробовать Space Marine 2 даже тем, кто не является фанатом вселенной Warhammer 40 000. Она красивая, необычная, бросает вызов и награждает за его преодоление. К тому же это игра от «наших» разработчиков. Такие выходят нечасто, но всегда радуют. Если это не Смута, лол (но её и игрой сложно назвать).
Разве что цена в 3200 слишком высока. Игре бы подошел рекомендуемый Valve эквивалент 60 долларов - 1900 рублей.

先说结论 锤粉建议入 路人和想找杀虫子的代餐建议不要入手

优点：游玩过程中没怎么碰到过其他玩家发生的bug, 而且优化也还可以,而且毕竟是目前市面上你能玩到最接近阿斯塔特的游戏了.战役内容可以提供大约10h的游玩过程, 演出很好

缺点：内容少非常少, 无法形容的少, 你打完战役会发现自己没事干了, 这里点名组队PVE, 而且单调枯燥. 而且并没有原作中爆弹怒杀虫子的感觉, 更多的是拿轮椅热熔无脑怼当喷子用, 目前给我的体验就是花200多看一场10h的演出.
如果是奔着找杀虫子代餐游戏来的话建议放弃, 虽然目前市面上两款打虫子游戏一个接近无限期停更一个策划不当人, 但很遗憾, 这游戏没法成为他俩的代餐

Я денно и ночно молился Богу Императору, чтобы Space Marin 2 не оказался убожеством сродни DOW 3.
И похоже Повелитель человечества ответил на мои молитвы. Игра получилась просто БОМБА. Вдвойне берет гордость, что эта игра сделана нашими Питерскими ребятами (за что им нереально огромнейший респект!!!)
С первых минут игры чувствуется почтение и огромная любовь к лору 40 тысячника. Декорации, модельки пехоты и техножрецов, антураж - все сделано по канонам моей любимой вселенной.
Сам геймплей бодрый и захватывающий. Пытался начать игру с геймпада на сложном уровне - так мне вломили таких люлей на обучении, что я еле его закончил))
Еще отмечу, что с нынешней тенденцией выпускать игры сырыми и забагованными - эта игра выгодно отличается своей качественно проведенной работой над багами перед релизом.

Кстати, у кого не получается запустить игру с геймпада - просто отключите систему ввода Steam в настройках геймпада.

В общем я очень рад, что игра удалась и с удовольствием проведу в ней ни один десяток часов.

Zerei o jogo no modo Anjo da Morte e demorei cerca de 20 horas, o gráfico do jogo esta incrível, sem quedas de FPS ( 4k sempre acima de 80 fps ), brutalidade e jogabilidade acessível, uma boa variedade de armas, unica contra que vejo aqui e que a IA dos companheiros e a mesma de uma porta, não da pra contar muito com eles, mas tirando esse detalhe matar uma horda de inimigos e sempre satisfatório. 9/10

Ich möchte mit dem negativen beginnen. Der PVP und der PVE Modus haben meiner Meinung nach zu wenig Missionen bzw. Maps. Bei dem PVP Modus ist dies nicht so schlimm doch bei PVE geht die Lust leider nach den 6 Missionen schnell raus. Server Probleme gab es jedoch nicht viele. Einige haben Grafikprobleme und sehen unsichtbare Charaktere wo aber dran gearbeitet wird. Ich persönlich hätte mir gewünscht das man seinen Space Marine individueller gestalten kann z.B. das man Namen, Stimme und Gesicht ändern kann.

Der Rest an dem Spiel ist sehr positiv. Das Kampfsystem macht jedes mal Bock und auf die Grafik wäre sogar der Imperator stolz da sie sogar sehr flüssig läuft. Interface und Audio wirken sehr gut überarbeitet und besonders die deutsche syncro kann sich durch aus hören lassen. Das absolute Highlight ist meiner Meinung nach die Kampagne. An der kann ich absolut nichts kritisieren da sie viel Spaß macht und die Inszenierung mehr als gut gelungen ist.

Mehr Content ist zwar bestätigt durch die Roadmap aber ich glaube dieser wird dauern da der Content bestimmt zeitgleich mit den Konsolen raus kommt. Wenn ihr auch PVP spielt kann euch das Game sehr lange fesseln!

В игре нет контента на данном этапе, кроме кампании на +-6 часов и тонны скинов для мультиплеера, которые надо гриндить на шести операциях. Дальний бой в игре ощущается кастрированным. Ближний бой гораздо практичнее, но при этом импакта от него почти никакого. Астартес будто палкой машут.

Дизайн конечно ебёт, но сильно расстроило, что опять в игре по вселенной появляется именно ересь Тризнча. В конце прошлого года уже выходила великолепная Rogue Trader, в которой тоже в основном были демоны Тзинча в основной сюжетке. Хочется в крупных играх посмотреть и на других хаоситов.

В целом я уверен, что эти разработчики еще наполнят игру множеством контента. И если игра будет интересна людям, будут её поддерживать несколько лет. Но на выходе для игры за 5к деревянных ну слишком слабо и пусто. Тот же Rogue Trader на релизе хоть и имел множество багов и сильные перекосы в балансе, но зато контента в нём было на 100+ часов. Да и стоил он сильно дешевле. Дальнобойное оружие все одинаковое по ощущениям, пользоваться чем то кроме тяжелых болтеров и мельты в целом и не хочется. Видов противников тоже крайне мало - 5 у тиранидов и 4 у хаоситов. Миссий мало, задачи на миссиях сводятся к нажиманию кнопочек на терминалах.

Еще показалось, что игре нехватает саундтрека. Не запомнилось ни одного трека, играющего на фоне. Как будто специально старались написать музыку, которая будет слегка и максимально ненавязчего приседать на ухо в момент перебежек по локациям. Но это же ваха, тут должны быть эпические оркестровые композиции. Как было в том же Rogue Trader, к слову.

С техническими проблемами не столкнулся вообще, один раз только из 20-30 сессий в операциях словил дисконнект, но больше было похоже на локальную проблему с сетью.

Если думаете покупать, но сомневаетесь - лучше подождите полгода-год. Тогда может и контента завезут, и скидки подрубят. На релизе нормально себя развлечь смогут только совсем отбитые фанаты вселенной.

Ver4.5追記：アップデートで通信周りが改善され普通に遊べるようになったようなので評価を変更しました。
ウォーハンマーの世界観をハイクオリティなグラフィックで楽しめます。普段ミニチュアゲームで楽しんでいる人にとってはキャラクターが動いて喋っているだけで感動ものですしオンラインでは見た目のカスタマイズも可能です。

ただ手放しにすべてを誉められるわけではなくオンラインモードは人を選ぶ印象です。
PvPとPvEが用意されていますがPvPはかなり大味なバランス、PvEは初見は楽しいものの用意されている育成要素に対してボリュームが少ないため求められる周回数はかなり多くすぐに単調に感じられてしまいます。さらに難易度が高めでソロでの周回も厳しいです。

ウォーハンマーの世界観を楽しみたい、オンラインはカジュアルに遊べればOKという方におすすめです。

＝＝以下追記前の内容です＝＝
通信が頻繁に切断されるバグを抱えているためオンライン関連のモードはすべてまともにプレイできません。
ストーリーモードの数時間分はオフラインで遊べますがそのためだけに購入するのは割高だと思います。

The style of the game is on point with satisfying gameplay, but it has some GLARING issues. I'd recommend it, but I hope it gets some polish soon!

Pros:
Style: The feel of the 40k universe is really hit on the head. This alone has probably gotten me through the game. I just really adore it.
Audio: Crunchy sound design is very satisfying.
Weapons: The gear you use feels pretty good, the design is limited, but it's loyal to the universe.
Gameplay: Fairly rhythmic fighting with parries, counters & dodges.
Big enemies: Boss fights can be tough ( Angel of Death difficulty ), but typically manageable ( caveat below ).
Story: The story is a bit shallow, but good enough.

Cons:
The most glaring issue is ally AI. It's horrendous, pathetically bad. This can make some boss fights an absolute slog when you're trying to balance yourself to proceed through the fight. It also destroys immersion seeing an Astartes knuckle f***ing himself in the corner while you're fighting for your life.
Hit boxes: The hit boxes are bad. You'll get hit at bizarre ranges & you'll often shoot invisible walls when attacking enemies. I've also been struck countless times through cover from ranged attacks.
Homing Melee Attacks: One the most annoying things in this game is enemies leaping at you ( not talking about parry counters ) & having them turn in the air or have them YA YEET themselves after you when you dodge.
Stun Lock: Though I understand it's a swarm hitting you & that's sort of the point, getting stun locked is just a poor choice. No one likes stun lock. No one likes losing control of their character. No one wants to have 2/3 of their health gone from 3 gaunts.

Edit:

Tacked on Feature: After finally playing the PvP I gotta' say it's pretty dog-sh*t. The fact that you have to re-level up just to use weapons is a very brain-dead decision. It's artificial play time that should not exist in a game where PvP feels like a tack-on to begin with. Being dumped into games where the majority of my team is > Level 10 & the opponents are < Level 20 is laughable. Less options, less-powerful gear ( in some aspects ) & less experience vs a team higher in all regards. Trashy.

Space Marine 2 is a thrilling continuation of the iconic Warhammer 40K universe. The game delivers an intense, action-packed experience that immerses players in epic battles as they fight to defend humanity. Its stunning visuals, fluid combat mechanics, and faithful representation of the Warhammer lore make it a standout. Fans of the franchise and newcomers alike will enjoy its high-octane gameplay and rich world-building.
Pros:
Stunning graphics and detailed environments
Fluid and satisfying combat system

Неплохая игра с сюжетной кампанией, которая не успевает надоесть.

Плюсы:

Отличная графика и дизайн, люди работавшие над окружением, оружием и бронёй - большие молодцы,ehe

Хорошие анимации оружия ближнего и дальнего боя, персонажей и боссов (особенно в кампании).

Сюжетная кампания была ОК, но общая тональность происходящего не ощущалась серьезно или мрачно.

Кооп хороший, все кроме скверного баланса меня радует. Особенно порадовала недавно добавленная 7 миссия.

PVP не трогал, но его наличие в качестве дополнительного контента тоже радует.

Минусы:

Тупиковый баланс сложности - мы просто сделает мобов на 400% жирнее.
Подавляющее часть оружия дальнего боя стреляет горохом вне зависимости от уровня редкости. Человек, который решил, что болтганы должно наносить мизерный урон, иметь огромный разброс и еще сверху накинуть ограниченный боезапас - ты нормальный? Урон оружия ближнего боя по элитным врагам тоже вызывает вопросы, хотя 10 ударов по одному (не мини-боссу) врагу не так раздражает как 30 выстрелов в голову до состояния добивания, что очень сильно вредит ощущению от стрельбы.

Ужасное микширование звука - сами звуки неплохие, но из-за микширования в них отсутствует импакт и "сочность".

Отстойный саундтрек, который уступает даже первой части. Особенно это касается музыки во время боя, когда играет какое-то напёрдывание или удары молоточков зацикленные по 10 раз. Заглавная тема - просто дженерик без харизмы, который не ужасен, но и забывается сразу после нажатия "начать игру". Эмбиент на Боевой Барже "ОК", но не более.

7,5 из 10. Крепкий середнячок. Разработчики развили некоторые аспекты оригинала(добавили парирования) и в целом проделали хорошую работу

This is a lesson on how to implode your game.

1. Take a game people are actually enjoying and go to town on it with a nerf bat...
2. Instead of buffing and balancing weapons and items you nerf multiple.
3. (Original issue still ongoing) Don't let people play the class they want (I.E. two of the same type of class cannot be in the same mission) and yet you don't program the matchmaking system to account for this.

Don't get me wrong I enjoy the game but for god sakes please don't go down the same hole so many other developers have. Due to this I can't honestly recommend this game at this time. Will definitely change the review if things change.

I want to like this game, but I can't recommend it when the first game is better in every way. Saber Interactive clearly has some big fans of the franchise in their midst, but the gameplay needs a lot more time in the oven.

Visually, the game is stunning. If you're a lore enjoyer, you're in for a good time.

The gameplay is passable to bad in the best of times. They attempt to wow you with some cool swarming tech, but once the novelty wears off, you're left with a lot to be desired.

Gunplay is bland and simple while Melee is clunky and unpolished. Hitting enemies feels like hitting a sponge. Dodge and Parry prompts aren't responsive and sometimes simply wont do anything at all. You'll take 3/4 of your health in damage for failing a prompt. Better hope someone on your team is killing the ranged enemies or that failed prompt will end with you dying while your character tries to stand up.

When an enemy's health gets low enough, they're stunned and prompt you to run over and Execute them with a special animation. When executed, you'll restore armor (not health). This would be great if smaller enemies didn't die in one hit, preventing you from executing them for armor. Don't forget that you're getting hit for a majority of your health, so, good luck! Sometimes it feels like it's is more efficient to recover health/armor by dying and letting your AI companions resurrect you. The overall flow of battle feels terrible when you're supposed to be a walking tank.

If you want to feel like a Space Marine, play the first game again.

Пройдена основная кампания на ветеране и все операции на текущий момент на второй сложности, игра просто великолепна и поражает тем, что такие классные игры вообще способны выходить в наше время. Концентрированный коридорный сюжет на 6-7 часов без помоев аля електроник артс или юбисофт на 100+ часов недогеймплея. Не менее крутые операции, которые прямо вплетены в сюжет и идут параллельно с ним. Миссии с реактивным ранцем это прям вишенка для итак супер вкусного тортика.
Построение и развитие персонажей, чувство недосказанности, кажется даже иногда излишнего молчания имеют смысл и подоплеку, да и сама вселенная способствует: каждый встречный не будет рассказывать во всех подробностях что и как делал в последнее время.
Кто то скажет что напарники главное героя кому то там что то продвигают, ну да, оба продвигают что в империуме дофига планет разных (не только земля клоповник как у нас на текущий момент). Хочу чтобы добавили в следующих операциях пару камео Эльдарочек, ибо с этой игры не разорвались только феминистки - время пришло
战役设计足够亮眼，每关都有与之对应的大场面，操作手感稳重扎实，代入感很强，我pve自己体验下来感觉还不错，没有频繁的掉线。美中不足的是战役阶段流程短而且牢泰没有成长要素（或许这也是计划好的？）pve现阶段可玩的地图太少，总的来说是一部优质的粉丝向作品
Как не фанату Вархаммера 40000, игра очень зашла)
游戏很好，更新很慢，制作组已被鸡贼参透

游戏评价目前推荐：针对锤粉和对艺术有兴趣的玩家。
甚至完全不如暗潮爽。
有几个非常大的问题希望你们9号游玩前知道。
1.枪反无法打断指令，而且不完全无敌，高难度下高血精英无法直接接处决，所以还是推荐近战处决。
2.奸奇在有些图是有bug的，上个场景（上个阶段）中未击杀的巫师会跨图复活千子，导致游戏几乎无法进行。
3.格挡有两段，二段是一个推击，但是推击是没有格挡的，以及格挡本身性能不强，无法支持混潮或者复数精英时的情况。
4.指令除了能被处决和格挡打断外，翻滚无法打断，也就是说你要翻滚必须结束上一次动作。导致雷霆锤这样动作帧很大的武器受苦。
5.这游戏目前没有奶妈，战斗回血比较严苛，有以下三种情况，一是盾卫在你旁边开大你立即接处决，二是守护道路复活后立即接处决，三是受伤后虚血立即处决。所以满盾该放给队友处就给队友。
6.高难远程生存能力不足，很难在清周围杂和处理精英得到平衡。目前两个主远程都有问题，主要体现在处理精英过慢，和没有队友很难处理利卡特和蛇虫。
7.机制方面，盾的作用其实是衔接，有盾-清杂/打伤-没盾-处决循环 保持战斗节奏用的，但一旦被远程近战黏上盾分钟没有的。
欢迎补充，PS. 对远程伤害真的很失望。

Love this game, but the latest patch has significantly lessened the enjoyment for me.

Specifically, the latest mechanic that requires your character to be in close proximity to your teammates in order to both regenerate armor (after ~25s of taking no damage) or regain armor through combat (parries/gun strikes/executions), absolutely needs to be adjusted or removed entirely.

This mechanic is currently broken (or at least I hope it is not intended to be this way) when you are the last survivor in your squad. The game does not allow you to regenerate armor, PERIOD. Good luck trying to survive an enemy wave on Lethal difficulty for 300s as you wait for team to re-spawn. It should be turned off when you are the sole survivor.

I swear the distance required to be considered within range of your squad is shorter than the distance I can throw a Melta Bomb. It also seems like the 25s armor regeneration timer resets if you happen to step out of that range. This can cause you to be without armor for what seems like minutes at a time, even if there is no enemies around. You can only pray your brothers don't just run off while your back is turned to them because you're Eight Trigrams Sixty-Four Palming a massive Tyranid wave trying to survive.

Sniper gameplay is significantly impacted by this change. It's hard to gain line-of-sight of ranged enemies or maintain safe positioning away from enemies when you're required to be within spitting distance of your team.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 - натурально, одна из лучших игр 2024 года.
Сразу стоит отметить, что я не ярый фанат, играл буквально в пару игр по вселенной, когда-то пытался разобраться в настолке, но бросил. В первую очередь я заинтересовался проектом, как АА-игрой от своих земляков.
Проходил Space Marine 2 в соло, изначально были планы поиграть с друзьями, но не срослось и сразу отмечу, что играть без кооператива ничуть не сложно даже на высоких сложностях, поэтому, если кто-то вам рассказывает о необходимости играть с компанией друзей - это необязательно.
Ещё важно отметить отличнейшую оптимизацию (на фоне других тайтлов 24 года, игра выглядит великолепно, но при этом требует куда меньше ресурсов).
Сюжет охватывает продолжение истории ультрамарина Тита, который вернулся из Караула Смерти и принялся за новые задания (советую первую часть пройти, чтобы полностью погрузиться в игру). А далее мы просто следуем указаниям командования, выполняем задания и по итогу прошлое нашего героя смешивается с настоящим, что выстраивается в новую эпичную историю.
Геймплейно игра охренительная, Очень сбалансирована сделана боевая система, где необходимо пользоваться не только огнестрелом, но и холодным оружием. Игра заставляет всегда находиться на средней дистанции, не уходить далеко от врага, но и не врываться в самый эпик. Есть множество миссий, которые приносят абсолютно новый опыт, какие-то интересные механики.
Помимо сюжетных миссий есть дополнительные задания, которые охватывают события, что происходили на фоне в главном сюжете. Здесь уже появляется прокачка, разные классы, что добавляет игре интереса. В дальнейшем разработчики обещают добавлять всё новые и новые миссии.
Мультиплеер отличный, в кои-то веки нам не надо бесконечно качать какие-то пушки, выбивать какие-то ранги. сетевая игра просто дарит веселые эмоции, чего давненько не хватало в современных играх.

Однозначно советую игру, как соло, так и командным игрокам, вы весело проведёте время.

Если хотите в полноте понять почему в Space Marine 2 надо поиграть, то вот мой ролик с ютуба

One of the most cinematic game stories I've experienced in a while! It's about 8-10 hours long, but it was fantastic!!! 
While I loved it, there are a few points I'd like to note.

A CHECKLIST

-----------------------------------------
✔️ Playable on GeForceNOW. Thank you developers!
✔️ An amazing campaign! While short and simple, it was full of action, an intriguing story and interesting characters!
✔️ Really impressive art design, brought to life in a lore-accurate direction. The brutality and bleakness of W40K are masterfully conveyed.
✔️ A simple, yet well-written storyline with plausible characters and interesting turn of events.
✔️ It gives you the feeling of a "classic" game. It's reminiscent of something we've lost in this oversaturated game market, but this game brings it back.
✔️ I don't know how it was for other people, but the game ran great for me. I didn't need to fine-tune any settings, and it was a great experience!
✔️ The game's universe has an incredibly passionate community around it! This will make you want to be a part of it and stick around.
✔️ The game was made to be played in co-op (I, however, played it solo). After finishing the campaign, you can do missions over and over in 3 game modes, with a progression system.
➖ While overall fun, I'm not always a huge fan of the combat. This game's combat feels like a combination of Doom and the Batman series' combat style, but needs finer tuning.
➖ It's not an open-world game, but that's not a bad thing. It's accessible for anyone to pick up and try, and it won't waste your time.
➖ Not a lot of content; however, I can say that the content that is there at the moment is good enough for you to pick this title up and give it a try.
➖ Not really a high variety of enemies, but then again, the game was less than 10 hours long, so it's understandable.
➖ It's not really a role-playing game as we (or at least I) are used to. There are no options in the dialogue; the story is cinematic and the same for everyone.
❌ Installs Epic Online Services automatically without prompting you for a choice. You can uninstall it anytime and the game will work just fine, but I really dislike these practices.
❌ Pfew, I'll say it. A POV slider would have been nice! The character takes up WAY too much of the screen space imo.


🕘 Release date: Sept, 2024
🕘 I've played it in: Oct, 2024
🕘 This would be my first experience with the Warhammer universe. A friend sent me a clip which got me hooked, and I ended up really enjoying the game!


⚠️ One of the greatest criticisms I have for this game, to be fair, is that "there isn't enough of it".
⚠️ The developers were clearly passionate when making this game. After learning about it and leading up to the first time I booted it up, I started "going down the rabbit hole" of the W40K universe. What I can see is that people, including the devs of this game, are strongly passionate about this universe. Their passion almost mirrors that which World of Warcraft had back in its "glory days," which is really nice to see again. You can be sure that this game has had its details perfected! I'm glad I got acquainted with the W40K universe before starting the game so that I was able to notice those details.
⚠️ I have not addressed the co-op/multiplayer aspect, because I haven't tried it yet. Once my friends get the title too, I'll cover that as well. The game seems to be made for multiplayer overall and it looks like the multiplayer part is quite enjoyable, but it will use the same chapters from the campaign, making them replayable and giving you a progression system.
⚠️ Community Rating at time of review: Very Positive


🔙 I've not played the first game, just this one so far. I'm seeing that many people played the first game and were in awe to have a sequel even after a long time. The devs/publisher did them justice with this entry!
🔙 I played on Normal difficulty, as I no longer have the patience for constant struggle, but the tuning felt odd sometimes. Missing a dodge could cost 80% of your HP, while executing an enemy only restored 1%. The execution takes a few seconds, locking you into the animation and making you immune to the swarming enemies around you. It seemed unsatisfying that even the tougher foes only granted 1% regen. In my opinion, 5% would have made it more rewarding and fun. The contrast between losing 80% HP for a dodge failure and gaining just 1% from an execution felt odd. What topped it off was the fact that you were never in danger, due to your teammates being able to revive you. I did not die a single time. This seemed a bit strange to me.
🔙 Never cared much about Warhammer until this game showed up. Now, I've cast away the heresy and fully embraced the Emperor's light. No longer do I wander in the shadow of ignorance!

Вот и пройдена мною игра
Сюжет
Сюжет очень простой, спойлерить не буду, но она мне зашла, тесно пересекается с сюжетом первой части(которую я не играл, но обязательно сыграю), что могу сказать вообще об сюжете - cюжет по типу "этот злой того надо убить, а этот предмет надо сломать", но даже так игра может удивить резкими поворотами, а в некоторых местах ты вообще не ожидаешь что произойдет дальше, в общем сюжет - нормальный, ставлю болтганов 7 из 10
Геймплей
Геймплей - обычное рубилово, но зато какое, крови жопой жуй, разных добивашек и анимаций тоже ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, есть парирование, уклон и какой то там выстрел и самое кайфовое это добивание... Тут добивание как в думе такое же кровавое и кайфовое, разные добивание на всех видов врагов от маленького жука тиранида до ебучего... А вы сами потом увидите кого можно добить, по крови тут 10/10 ее ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ и мне это нравится. За гемплей ставлю 9 ВАААГХ из 10.
Графика без вопросов - ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, как будто фильм смотришь, мимика лица, качество брони, детали карты и вообще всего что есть на карте выглядит ахуенно. Про атмосфера карты и самой игры так же зашкаливает, в некоторых моментах идут мурашки по коже, настолько она ахуенна.
В общем ставлю 10 цепных мечей из 10
Главный герой он максимально продуман, его характер, его речь просто ахуенны, когда играешь за него ты ощущаешь себя настоящим лейтенантом роты ультрамаринов.
Капитан, Капеллан и Калгар - все они тоже сделаны прикольно и продуманно, у каждого из них разное отношения к гг, капеллан например не особо доверяет главному герою и говорит что он будет следить за ним всегда, капитан же любит гг(не в том смысле) он доверяет ему и выдает сложные задания, а Калгар просто обожает гг, он сильно доверяет ему и верит в него
Второстепенные персонажи - два второстепенных персонажа которые проходят с нами компанию они сделаны тоже очень хорошо, у каждого из них свой характер и говор, каждый из них относится к еретикам, тиранидам и гг разное, есть моменты в которых я за них сильно волновался
Персонажи в виде классов - играл я только за двух конечно, но потом обязательно сыграю за других.
Класс "поддержка" - молчалив и строг, общается только военными фразами и словами, за него убивать кайф, тяжелый болтер делает рататата и вот взорвалась врага голова
Класс "Штурмовик" - также молчалив, но менее строг, убивать за него отдельный кайф, он просто ненавидит еретиков и ксеносов, поэтому и кричит как он их сильно не любит
В общем за персонажей я ставлю 8 капелланов из 10
В общем я уверен что эта игра года, если же нет - меч императора мне в жопу, игра абсолютно заслуженно получила столько положительных отзывов.
Ставлю 10 сестер битвы из 10(прошу строго не оценивать мою оценку, делаю такую подробную впервые)

Pre patch 3, this game would have been one of my highest recommended Warhammer 40K games ever made.

Now? Probably not.

Gameplay loop and game feel were fantastic PRE Patch 3, some balancing was off, but overall it was hectic fun challenge on Ruthless/Angel of Death (Difficulty 4) and it felt like an earned victory when you and your buddies pulled it off.

Post Patch 3, there are practically no enemy hordes throughout each Operations level, certainly none that are overwhelming. There are tiny little groups of enemies that pose no real threat scattered distantly from each other so you have plenty of time to to kill the five or six enemies on screen and then run for 2-3 minutes taking in the sights with nothing to do to the next tiny group of enemies, any big bad type enemies spawn in basically solo, so you can easily focus them with no pressure and destroy them in seconds. Can now easily Duo every Operations on Difficulty 4 and grind with no real challenge, but why would I? It's dull to play currently and more prone to crashing.

The campaign was a fantastic, and focused fight for your life on launch and the story beats are still wonderful, loved seeing Titus make his return. Played on Angel of Death the first time through with a buddy and it took us about 10-12 hours. It was a really fun overcoming the odds by being a good team and covering each other. Not anymore.

Currently I could replay the campaign post Patch 3 on Angel of Death and solo it without resistance. That's not fun or a challenge. Why even have different difficulties at this point if they're all easy mode.

I will gladly change my review if they fix the spawn rates, fix the constant crashing and make this fun to play again.

Quando ho completato la campagna single player di Space Marine 2, mi sono trovato in una situazione piuttosto frustrante. Da un punto di vista estetico, il gioco è sempre stato eccezionale: graficamente impressionante e perfettamente fedele all'universo di Warhammer 40,000. Le battaglie epiche e gli scenari mozzafiato erano in grado di immergere completamente il giocatore, e l'esperienza single player, anche in modalità cooperativa, funzionava a meraviglia, offrendo ore di puro divertimento. Tuttavia, a quel tempo, c'era un grosso problema che mi impediva di godermi il titolo appieno.

Quando provavo ad accedere alle modalità multiplayer PVE e PVP, il gioco crashava costantemente dopo pochi minuti dall'inizio di una partita. Non ero il solo ad affrontare questo problema: molti altri utenti riportavano situazioni simili, il che rendeva la frustrazione ancora più grande. Avevo provato diverse soluzioni, ma senza successo, e mi trovavo costretto a valutare negativamente un gioco che, nonostante la sua qualità visiva e il suo potenziale, risultava ingiocabile per una parte significativa dell'esperienza.

Fortunatamente, con l'ultimo aggiornamento, tutto è cambiato. Gli sviluppatori hanno finalmente risolto il bug che causava il crash nelle modalità multiplayer, e ora posso dire che Space Marine 2 è tornato a essere un titolo che merita davvero. Le modalità PVE e PVP funzionano perfettamente, e posso finalmente godermi l'intero pacchetto di gioco senza problemi.

This review is long and will feel like a rant but its my genuine feelings and I don't think I am being too reactionary here.

Starting with the good/okay aspects.

The atmosphere in this game is truly incredible, you feel completely immersed in the 41st millennium and the sound design and animations are gorgeous.

The campaign is a solid 6.5/10 it is quite literally, just the first games story, rehashed slightly, complete with fun and interesting enemy, who you get to fight for too short of an amount of time, before the tedious and boring one. It fulfilled the power fantasy and was a compelling enough story that once it kicked off I wanted to see it through as quickly as possible.

The PVE Operations are the strength of this game by far, it is a lot of fun playing with two friends and earning gear and unlocking perks. I look forward to seeing how they expand on it.

Now for my issues with the game.

Customization is hidden behind a grind, which is fine, progression isn't inherently bad, however, the way you unlock emblems and color palettes feels needlessly convoluted, they can only be unlocked in a specific order once you pick a faction and the currency used to unlock things is shared with the PVE game mode perks, and the weapon skins making it a bit grindy. These customization options are really cool! But don't think you can place that particular Iron Warriors Skull on your RIGHT pauldron, I am afraid that one is restricted to the LEFT pauldron only. That really cool metallic you found that would be perfect for your chapter's main color? Sorry, that is a tertiary color only, it can be used for trim and nothing else.
Speaking of traitor marines, the customization for them is basically non existent (On a side note, after customizing my marine, I have played 12 straight games of Chaos where I can't see it, which is hilarious).

PvP is okay, but it feels more like a demo for the game mode that has yet to be released. There are only 3 maps, and 3 game modes. The classes all feel well made and overall balanced. Close combat however feels like it has the depth of a puddle, it is generally whoever lands the first attack wins. Parrying does nothing but block damage, there is no stagger, no window for you to attack back, your opponent can just keep flailing away and you must hope a teammate comes to your rescue. I think utilizing the very fun parry system in the campaign would've been a slam dunk and added depth. I mostly play sniper so this isn't hugely impactful for me, but still.

I could go on more, but honestly this game feels more like a demo than a full release, which is crazy to say after a decade of waiting. I will continue to play here and there with friends because I love the universe, but if this game was anything other than 40k I would not be playing it at all.

+I WILL BE USING THIS MORTAL VESSEL TO PASS MY JUDGMENT+

+It is with a gaze that has witnessed a million battles, a gaze that sees far beyond the limits of mortal comprehension, that I have deigned to examine this creation worthy of your time. And though the centuries have weathered countless conflicts, none have dimmed the fires of my eternal judgment. Hear me now, for my word is as binding as the stars themselves.+

+This... recreation of warfare seeks to glorify the deeds of the Adeptus Astartes, the finest of my creations, who carry my will into the void. In this, it is an admirable representation, capturing the brutal reality of battle with an unflinching hand. You, the player, are placed into the power-armored boots of a Space Marine, a once Captain of the Ultramarines, no less. Titus, once a hero of legend, returns to unleash righteous fury against the xenos filth that dare threaten the Imperium.+

+The graphics, like the eternal architecture of Terra itself, are grand and imposing, crafting a galaxy teeming with life and war. You will witness the burning skies, the shattered ruins of planets, and the never-ending tides of the enemy with such clarity that you might forget, for a brief moment, the fragility of your own existence. The immersion is total; you are the embodiment of my wrath, and for that, I commend the creators.+

+But let it not be said that my judgment is blind to faults. The enemies, while numerous and suitably grotesque, are repetitive in their design, much like the countless masses of orks and tyranids I have destroyed over millennia. Their minds are as predictable as the winds of Cadia before its fall. And though the combat is fierce and satisfying, there is a rhythm to it that one may find tiresome after enough time. Yet I understand the limitations of mortal creativity, and I am forgiving.+

+Where the game shines, however, is in the portrayal of the Adeptus Astartes. Each blow, each strike feels heavy with the weight of a thousand years of warfare, and each step resounds with the thundering presence of an unstoppable force. You are no mere man in this world, but a demigod among men, and the gameplay reflects that truth in glorious fashion.+

+The story, though not as intricate as the weave of fate I have spun for humanity, serves its purpose. It is a tale of defiance in the face of oblivion, a tale the galaxy knows all too well. Titus stands, as all Space Marines must, as the last bulwark against annihilation. Though his struggles are but a fragment of the grand narrative, they are a necessary reminder of the eternal struggle against darkness.+
Pain is an illusion of the senses, despair is an illusion of the mind.

Alright, listen up, people! I just played Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, and let me tell you, it’s an absolute spectacle. Imagine a world where chaos reigns, and you’re the unstoppable force. Yeah, that’s what it feels like!

First off, the graphics? Stunning. The environments are drenched in that grimdark aesthetic we all crave. You step onto the battlefield, and it’s like stepping into a painting, only this one’s drenched in blood and glory. You can almost taste the power oh, how I love that taste!

Now, the gameplay. It’s intense, brutal, and oh-so-satisfying. You’re a Space Marine superhuman, unstoppable. You charge into the fray, and every swing of your weapon feels like a symphony of destruction. The visceral combat? It’s poetry in motion, folks. You’re not just playing; you’re dominating.

And let’s talk about the enemies. These guys are nothing but fodder for your glorious rampage. You’re the hero, the legend, the one everyone looks up to. You know what they say: if you’re not fighting for humanity, what are you even doing?

In the end, Space Marine 2 isn’t just a game; it’s an experience. It’s a reminder that power is everything, and in this universe, you’re either a god or you’re dust. So, grab your chainsword and unleash chaos! This is what it means to be a Space Marine.

Remember, if you want to be a hero, you’d better be ready to step into the fire and trust me, it’s glorious!

As of writing this review I have never been more torn on whether to recommend a game or not.

The campaign has moments which will make Warhammer fans giddy like a kid at Christmas, especially on the last two missions (if you've played it you know.) Even non Warhammer fans will have a good time with this. The voice acting, graphics and audio are all strong.
However, it's criminally short. Took me about 5.5 hours to complete and I died...a lot.

The AI in this game is something out of 2004. Squad mates will watch you getting annihilated and not budge an inch, or decide to stand in front of you as you attempt to lay waste to heretics. It's infuriating, and something you'll need to get used to because the online matchmaking in SM2 is straight up cheeks. I hope you enjoy restarting your game a lot, and loading screens, because you'll become familiar with both.

Bugs, crashes, loooong loading times, and infinite loading times are going to likely infest your experience worse than any Tyranid could, and this after the game was already pushed back a considerable amount of time.

The core game play of SM2 is really solid. Any third person shooter fans, especially those that enjoyed Gears of War are going to have a great time. It's challenging, brutal and unapologetic in it's approach. It knows it's target audience and swings for the fences, and most of the time it connects.

This game will live or die in the next 3-6 months on how much the Dev will support it.
Fixing the myriad of tech issues, and bringing more content to coop and multiplayer. More maps are needed, it's a non-negotiable.

SM2 is a real mixed bag. A frustrating, disappointing mixed bag all within a room filled with potential. This could be something truly special but it's not there...yet.

I'm going to reluctantly recommend it purely because I'm a Warhammer fan, and there are moments in this game that are perfection, but as a non Warhammer fan wait for a sale. By that time you'll have a feel for how many of the issues have been fixed, and what the landscape is looking like with more content to make it worthwhile.

So 80 Hours in this game features 3 distinct parts.


TLDR: game looks and sounds great, very true to source material

campaign story is decent but nothing to write home about. great spectical but obviously parts were cut from it. maybe not enough time, still good fun, specially in coop.

PVE mode 3 player coop in style of darktide, L4F etc, has a lot of meat to sink your teeth into, customisation, leveling etc.

PVP more 6vs6 with 3 game modes and 3 maps. fun but lacking a lot of content and is a 2010 style shooter.

BUY if you like the PVE or PVP campaign is not worth the full price

LONG VERSION

outside of PVP the gameplay is a 3rd person shooter where you can often run out of ammo but that where melee comes in. this has a whole melee system with attack combos, blocking parrying, doging in it. kind of like the lastes god of war games. if you take damage you lose armor which regenerates after 30 seconds or you can execute enemies to get some back. when out or armor you loose health which you can get back by doing damage a short time after taking it. like in bloodbourne. if you miss that short mindow there are me packs that restore some health and some classes can get health back r hel other with it.

so now you run around and 20 small enemies + a handfull elites leading them show up. you shoot and melee the hell out of them taking damage, regenerating armour by executing which also give you i-frames. blocking, doging parrying etc. with enough pratice it becomes a dance of death. which can be really fun when you get into "the flowstate" of the combat.

a single player campaign:
playable with up to 3 players in coop. this is the main story. features no progression or leveling or armor customisation. the story is and plot is ok. nothing fancy but servicable. in terms of looks and sound its great though. bombastic and warhammer as hell. depending on your difficulty you will play this for about 8-10 hours. good for one playthough but thats it. there are a lot of shooters that deliver a better story. but the spectacle is here.

adjacent to the campaign is the operations mode:

you play 3 marines can choose from 6 diffent classes featuring unique skills and skill trees ofthen even unique weapons. you play 3 player coop missions kind of like darktide, left 4 dead etc. with a director that keeps thing fresh and sets up enemy spawns etc.

this mode features full leveling of weapons and classes with skill trees with 4 difficulty levels. this is where i spend 90% of my playtime. leveling different classes and their weapons earning ingame currency to buy their gear and customize their armor look from the 9 loyalist legions + a plethora of 1st and second founding astartes chapters. armor visual customization looks really good. in this mode i have arnound 60-70 hours and have maxed 4 of the 6 classes but often just a handfull of their available weapons.


next is the 6vs6 pvp modes, it is disconnected from the other modes in terms of progression and although you have the same classes some skills are slightly different and you only unlock weapon loadouts & cosmetics. there are no skilltrees or weapon skill trees. you also earn ingamemoney you can use in the operations mode to unlock new cosmetics and weapons.

you play loyalist vs traitors while for loyalist you can customize way the traitors models are locked in in terms of model but you can customize colors & emblems. so for example the vanguard is always a world eater, the heavy always death guard. but you can color them differently.

3 game modes, deathmatch, domination and capture and hold. on only 3 maps.
the game modes are fine, the maps are fine but it is all very COD 2010. spawncamping can easily happen. matchmaking isnt great. the melee system is gutted compared to pve modes, you can parry and block but besides negating damage but you dont get an advantage for it over the enemy. thoug melee ignores armor. besides that you regenerate armor faster than in pve and even heal quite fast.
it is fun but has its problems lacking content and using dated mechanics.

still very fun game and if you play the PVE coop mode or enjoy the PVP you can get a lot of hours out of it.
if you are only here for the campaign. better way for a sale.
Oh, I got to tell you, it was perfect. Perfect! Everything, down to the last, minute details.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 is nothing short of a triumph, seamlessly merging intense combat with a gripping narrative in a way that will captivate both long-time fans and newcomers alike. This latest installment in the Warhammer 40K universe sets a new standard for action-packed shooters with its impeccable blend of brutal melee combat, strategic gunplay, and stunning visuals. Saber Interactive really came through with this installment. It is a game that long time fans of Warhammer 40k truly have been asking for.

From the moment you step into the power armor of a Space Marine, the game impresses with its attention to detail. The graphics are absolutely breathtaking paired with a bombastic audio design, Space Marine 2 showcases the grimdark universe with a level of realism that immerses you completely. The environments are richly detailed, from the war-torn landscapes to the imposing architecture of the Imperium’s strongholds.

The combat is where Space Marine 2 truly shines. The gameplay feels both fluid and weighty, with a seamless transition between hand-to-hand combat and ranged weaponry. The abilities and upgrades add depth and variety, ensuring that each encounter remains fresh and exhilarating. The game’s AI is notably sharp, presenting a formidable challenge that keeps you on your toes without ever feeling unfair.

Narratively, the game excels in delivering a compelling story set against the backdrop of a galaxy in turmoil. The voice acting and script are top-notch, with a storyline that feels both epic and personal. The character development is rich, and the dialogue manages to balance gravitas with moments of dark humor, adding layers to the experience.

Multiplayer has a offering of diverse modes and a progression system that keeps the action engaging and competitive. Whether you’re battling in co-op missions or competing in PvP, the multiplayer experience is both rewarding and addictive. Looking forward to see what Saber Interactive does with future content.

In summary, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 is a masterclass in combining thrilling gameplay with a deep, immersive world. It’s a must-play for fans of the franchise and a standout entry for those new to the universe. This game not only meets but exceeds expectations, proving itself as a benchmark in the genre. Prepare for a relentless, adrenaline-pumping adventure that you won’t soon forget.

看看cpu利用率和温度，再看看gpu利用率和温度。然后再看游戏里面帧数波动。总结就是垃圾优化。
优化确实存在问题的，身边有人电脑动不动100°，帧率感觉上也一直有问题，一开始我还不是很信一些人所说的优化灾难，但现在玩了这么长时间发现确实如此。在平常时间段内帧率正常，但不论pvp还是pve，只要场面一旦变大，显卡占用率只有一半，但cpu百分之80+开始爆破，帧数也开始变得很不稳定。
只能说这是一款将单烤cpu融入游戏内容的创新大作。

Finished the campaign solo on Angel of Death difficulty.
I want to keep the review somewhat short:
- Was very challenging but doable.
- Definitely a good experience solo
- Would've been much more fun however co-op, because the co-op ai can be a bit stupid at times. And you get focused a lot by the enemy. I would still heavily recommend it, even alone.

PvE Operations:
- 6 of them, very fun. Take a decent amount of time. Very replayable, if you like stepping up difficulty and enjoy weapon & class progression.

Performance:
Specs:
4080 super
Ryzen 7 7800x3d
32 gb ram

Super stable, roughly 120 frames +- on everything maxed. Only one bug in the entire playthrough, which was minor. Couldn't pick up a singular health item.

Pvp:
- Very fun, different classes. Very little downtime in the action. Quite some skill expression surprisingly.

My Dearest Martha,

I write this letter having been beset by Tyranid scum and Chaos villainy. I have finished the main campaign with my AI brothers and there is much to say.

They say war is hell and while that is true here it is a very pretty hell. The sights and sounds of battle are massive in scale and in quality. Watching enemies explode into bloody bits or some magical dust ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ was always satisfying. While most of my time was spent with two other squad mates there was always a feeling of a larger campaign at play. Sometimes from background battles raging, but also in those moments when you are charging forward alongside a massive army.

The spectacle is really incredible and I found, in general, the combat to be fun. Guns felt like that had impact and "oomph" melee weapons had weight. It felt good to run around, see the sights, and fight. All the pieces make for an extremely compelling experience that I couldn't walk away from, even if occasional issues would cause the odd rage-quit.

So let's talk about the bad stuff, because this has not been all roses. For every time you get a jump pack and the game gets 100x more fun there are a few things and missions that bring the overall experience down.

First off - this game is clearly a multiplayer/COOP game first. The AI squad is awful. They get the most important part right, which is trying to revive you if you go down, but beyond that they are poor in combat, and almost non-existent when it comes to objectives or tactics. Now it's okay to make a game where you want COOP as a focus, but if you are going to advertise and push that it's a solo game too you do need to properly support that experience and I think the game falls incredibly short in this key area.

In fact I think that if you had a better, more effective, and/or commandable squad the other issues I have might not matter. I also felt that for a giant armored Space Marine I felt like dolled up tissue paper. The game asks a lot in terms of special blocks, regular blocks, special dodges, regular dodges, pistol counters, executions, ranged fighting, and melee swarms all at once, but gives very little health and armor to support all of that even on the baseline difficulties. It doesn't make the game impossible by any means, but it does make it a little less fun.

Still I can't help but think that much of this is less of an issue if my squad was doing a better job of not making me fight everything mostly alone possibly while juggling objectives and in one really bad stage while also using a flamethrower to keep swarms at bay.

While I've focused on issues a bit I think overall my net experience with the game is far more better moments than troubled ones. There was only one stage I hated (the swarm bunker thing) and a few objectives that made me long for less brain-dead brothers at my side. It didn't prevent me from completing the campaign over a few days because I couldn't stop playing. They are also all issues that can be fixed.

So often we see games come out with problems way beyond the scope of a patch, but in the case of Space Marine 2 I don't think there is anything that couldn't be improved down the line. Hopefully they actually make some of these improvements, because I think this game could be damn-near perfect if they did.

Also as these issues are almost all tied to the single player experience, if you are playing online or with friends I think realistically you are just going to have a much better time. So it's an easy recommend to online/COOP players and while I still recommend it to solo player I do warn that there are some pain points, especially on higher difficulties from your AI companions.

At a time where my gaming has been an hour here, an hour there, try this, try that, Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2 became my world for a few days. Despite the blood and carnage of it all it was a glorious focus and a stellar time.

For the Emperor,
Revendawn

If you have grown up with the Warhammer tabletop, digital and what it represents.
If you like everything that surrounds the world of Warhammer... you know that you will like it if or if.
If you don't know anything about Warhammer... don't even bother to enter, you'll never understand it, because you are a Chaos Heretic.

Para empezar habría que dividir en dos partes, una para personas normales y otra para fans de W40K, yo creo que seria la mejor forma de describir lo que es este juego.

Para personas normales, el juego se ve muy bien gráficamente, lo peor son los personajes, que se ven bien, pero no llega al fótorealismo de los escenarios, en cuanto a rendimiento, no lo estoy jugando a todo en alto/ultra menos las texturas, porque me pide más de 8 Gb de Ram de vídeo para poder usar textura en ultra. Yo he usado DLSS y obtengo una media de frames sobre los 60 a 2K, lo cual me parece muy bien optimizado, y no suele caer cuando llevan cientos de enemigos en pantalla. A mi me resulta muy familiar este juego con World War Z, en cuanto a mecánicas y dificultad, para mi no es un juego fácil, al igual que WWZ necesitas mejorar mucho tu equipo para poder sobrevivir a las oleadas, pero acaba de salir y todo esto estará sujeto a cambios. En un buen juego, para relajarte unas horas al día, masacrando enemigos de manera brutal, pero si quieres estar muchas horas enganchado, en mi caso me cansa, es decir, perfecto para jugar unas horas al día, pero a partir de 2 o 3 horas, puede hacerse pesado ese día, pero al día siguiente lo vuelves a disfrutar como un niño. Pese a la campaña, y los modos de juego PVE es necesario estar online para subir experiencia, si juegas offline, pues no avanzas, y en PVP evidentemente online siempre, ahora mismo el juego lo veo algo falto de contenido, supuestamente con el roadmap, van a seguir sacando nuevo contenido, pero hoy por hoy, para mi, lo veo escaso, el juego consiste en repetir y repetir hasta conseguir las mejores puntuaciones, tiempos y con la mayor dificultad.

Para fans de Warhammer, con todas las opciones de personalización en cuanto esquema de colores, adornos, insignias, te pasaras horas diseñando tu marine espacial preferido, tu propio capitulo e incluso si le echas imaginación tu propio personaje. Y en el modo foto, es como si tuvieras su partida de mesa de Warhammer en tu pantalla, todo el ambiente te lleva al loco y distópico futuro de W40K.

En resumen, el juego esta divertido, el contenido cosmético extra solo lo veo necesario si eres un fan aférrimo del W40K y te puedes permitir la burrada que vale cada tontería. Para una persona que no conoce W40K, puede parecerle caro o poco contenido, y que hay otros juegos mejores, para gustos los colores, solo espero haberte ayudado con esta reseña. De todos motos si no lo tienes claro, espera a la demo o ve vídeos de gameplay en youtube o streaming, ahora una cosa, el codec de vídeo no le hace justicia a como se ve el juego en tu pantalla.

NOTA: El juego usa servidores para el progreso y modos multijugador, pero según roadmap, se podrá crear un servidor privado y offline, y deberías subir experiencia, o al menos en modo offline como ocurre WWZ (esto esta en el aire, veremos a ver como lo hacen al final), se puede jugar perfectamente sin conexión a Internet en modo desconectado, o simplemente sin conexión a Internet. Lo único no avanzas en experiencia a tus personajes, por tanto no desbloqueas, mejoras, cosméticos, etc,

Como aclaración en WWZ, que tiene dos modos el online que tiene su propio nivel de progreso, y el offline, es decir, si yo juego online, y llevo a nivel 10, en el offline sigo a nivel 0 o viceversa. Yo me gusta así porque siempre no quiero jugar con gente desconocida, y simplemente me apetece macharcar Tiranidos a mi bola tranquilamente sin que el subnormal de turno me este disparando para que corra (esto es ya verídico, y si, hay fuego amigo).

Space Marine 2 is a worthy successor to the original...and having played it for many hours and competed in the pvp side of Space Marine, I can tell you this with pride and joy.

While having some fundamental changes to the mechanics, the core is still there - and the additions / changes don't remove anything; in fact it contributes to the power fantasy. With practice and dedication - and some nice Relic weapons, you can wade through Lethal like it's your first time doing Substantial.

The graphics are awesome, attention to lore is fantastic, and the overall feel of the game gives you a level of immersion I haven't had in ages. Some mentioned this is a reminder of what we've lost, but look at what's been found.

And consecrated by the gaming community!

Relic's done a pretty decent job so far handling the community, and their responsiveness and willingness to engage is a great predictor for the future of this game.

I have high hopes that I'll be fisting the enemies of the Imperium for years to come.

With respect and Honour!

~The FreyMan

Space Marine 2 is a long-awaited, much-hoped-for sequel to the first Space Marine game. You play as <REDACTED> (jk it's freaking Titus like that wasn't obvious enough) who starts off using Primaris-styled equipment as a regular first-born marine. Hmm. Can't say that's particularly lore accurate, but whatever, it's Titus so that's cool. Unfortunately he's no Mark Strong this time, can't blame him after everything that happened. Be aware.

I tried playing the campaign missions on Angel of Death difficulty. This will color my breakdown below.

The 'nids are, as expected, annoying ass space bugs that swarm you faster than skaven do at a Warpstone rave party, and they're fairly dangerous. In fact, each of them individually might not seem like a problem but start throwing in 3 or so hormagaunts and you'll start having more stab wounds than a mugging victim in London. The termagaunts, those little annoying freaking shooty bugs, appear to not wield regular fleshborers, since the damn things flash green like miniature rapid-fire venom cannons. If you don't know what a venom cannon is, I'll explain it further down below in the Warrior section.

All of these swarm mechanics overwhelming you through sheer numbers is really pronounced. I started having to take engagements carefully and seriously right from the get-go. You can't regenerate any health from simple executions this time either, you need to have taken damage recently (a la Bloodborne) and this makes Titus not only feel like tissue paper, but unable to recover easily. You need to use the medical stims and those are far and few in between, so they definitely took the 'its too easy' critique about the first game too much to heart. Titus will find these enemies dangerous and annoying in equal measure as a result, so don't go thinking you can charge into the jaws of hell and not get tarpitted harder than Abbadon facing a 50 block of guardsmen backed up by a Commissar Lord. They are just as fearless as said guardsmen and unlike Abbadon, Titus can't ♥♥♥♥ out like 10 attacks in a single round of combat, so you better hope you're good at parrying.

Note that while parrying or dodging or attacking, you are more or less animation locked. You can't cancel easily, and this honestly makes you feel a lot more sluggish than Captain Titus, who is now obviously the best version of Titus there was. This means you have to thin their numbers at range, hopefully reducing the 'gaunt variants down to less than 3 by the time the Warrior rushes you down.

Let's talk about Warriors. Warriors are the big 'nids that have that annoying ass whip, that annoying ass paired boneswords, that really annoying ass devourer, or that annoying ass venom cannon (that long snout thing).
The Whip is not too bad in a 1 on 1, just make sure to either stay clear of it while wiping out the small forms or...dunno, charge in and beat it to death before it can get really annoying. When it does that lash combo attack, it's very hard to parry so you're better off just trying to keep your distance and shooting it down.
The twin boneswords is just tanky. That's it.
The devourer is basically a rapid-fire fleshborer, and the Warrior who uses it is the most irritating PoS you will ever encounter. It will constantly skate away to the backline to pepper you with clusters of projectiles and it adds up a lot of damage very fast. Snipe this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ as soon as possible. If you try to close in melee, it will sometimes unload every shot into you at point-blank range and you can die from this.
The last one, the venom cannon wielder, is the sniper variant. A venom cannon is like a biological railgun except instead of shooting a metal projectile it shoots this venomous acidic crystal that is superheated by the electrical discharge (yes, this is how it works in lore) and is launched at high speed to penetrate vehicles...or something. It didn't really work against real vehicles, but it definitely works against MEQ (shorthand for 'marine equivalent') like Titus. You will get a warning in the form of a sickly green laser tracking you and you can dodge the shot quite easily with good timing. The real problem is when one of them shows up and you are fighting a swarm or two and their Warrior melee cousins all at the same time, which is when things get nasty. Even then, its particular attacks are not hard to avoid, so either trust in your mobility or kill them off first, your choice.

There's more bug variants and their stupid tactics but I'm tired of talking about bugs so let's talk about weapons.

Gunplay and melee aren't mutually exclusive, it retains the general fluidity of the first game and you can swap between the two styles of combat very fast. Pistols are actually useful, they take their own slot and can help offset some disadvantages of your primary, while also serving as a way to perform kill shots on parried enemies.

Bolters. Holy Emperor the bolters. There are so many bolter variants, and some of them being very cross purposes with their actual function to the point it makes you wonder who needs this many variants. They are all lifted from the Primaris arsenal, and you get the whole freaking line of them (except Assault Bolters). Bolt carbines, heavy bolt pistols, auto bolt rifles, you name it they have it. In fact, I would argue that there are simply too many bolters. In the first game most of the same roles were replicated by unique weapons, such as the plasma gun, the lascannon, the vengeance launcher, and so on. Now you get...bolters.

Some of them are effective and some are not, but all of them are only average on Angel of Death difficulty so I didn't really find them to be that unique. What stood out were the non-bolter weapons, the Plasma Incinerator and the Melta Rifle.
The Plasma Incinerator is like a cross between the regular plasma gun and a very small plasma cannon, and it performs well enough in that role. It's plasma and it hurts.
The Melta Rifle is basically just like the melta gun from the first game. Tight AOE cone that does more damage the closer to the center of the aiming circle you get, huge shotgun blast that can melt anything.
There's some other stuff like the Las Fusil, which is basically just a lascannon if they scaled it down and in-game it's basically a Charge Rifle from Titanfall. It's still a good weapon, but they clearly learned their lesson from the first game where the lascannon's instant shot could utterly destroy an unfortunate enemy's face at close range.

Melee weapons unfortunately all feel a little samey. The chainsword is effective but it only swings in tight arcs and relies on a charge attack combo to stun enemies, which is extremely awkward compared to the first game where your stun/charge attack was another key altogether. This means it is very easy to start a chainsword combo then get hit for your trouble because you have no way of interrupting your enemy.
The power sword is a little more forgiving as it has actual stances that emphasize AOE or single target combat. It still has the issue of not being able to stagger big creatures reliably, or having a charge attack combo that matters, but it is reliable enough with its large sweeping attacks to actually outperform the chainsword on a regular basis.
The thunder hammer took a big hit from last game. It is just as sluggish and slow despite Titus' better augmentations, but is weaker. You can put a lot of hurt on enemies, but you have too many gaps open that leave you unable to defend yourself properly. Compare that to the first game, where the hammer's instant-kill damage and reliable stun combo can AOE wipe out hordes of daemons or whatever. It's very weak in this game.
The power fist staggers most enemies. Good enough.

So Is game gud? yes. Get. Play. Keel bug.

This is a rather difficult game to review as a non-Warhammer fan. Because from my perspective it is a competent hack-and-slash-shooter devoid of personable characters or any intriguing plot-elements. But to a Warhammer fan it is grimdark-personified; each human a cog in the Emperor's ever-marching war machine which renders every man and women as barren of life as the land itself.

Thus, this is less of a review of the story, and more so the game itself. Graphically, it looks rather stunning--with majestic vistas of the skull-regaled factories of the city worlds to the gruesome, steaming swamps of the backwater worlds. And while some people have reported issues of high-temps and crashes--issues that should be looked into and addressed--for the most part, and across a variety of systems, the game seems to run rather well. That shouldn't be a pro for any game, it should just be the standard. But it's 2024, so... bar's been pretty low for a while now.

The overall gameplay loop consists of running down un-inspired corridors to face random-sized groups of enemies. And while the campaign is mercifully and justifiably short, devoid of any diversity of gameplay or objectives, what you're then left with is the Operations Mode. Best described as a Raid Mode of sorts. You're expected to run through these over and over to level up your character(s) and your equipment to then run these maps on a higher difficulty. And therein shines both the game's main strength and its main flaw. In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war. And that motto does a lot to encapsulate the gameplay loop. There is only combat, and random objectives that rely on more combat. So it's a damn good thing then that the combat feels so damn good. Taking a chainsaw sword to a group of alien-baddies twice as short and thrice as frail as you will have you feeling like the Emperor's Chosen; pistols sound like a cannon and kick just as hard, and destroy just as much. Sniper Rifles are downright busted in the right hands. And I'll never, ever tire of grappling toward an enemy to deliver a skull-crushing dropkick. It speaks volumes that in a game with such limited enemy-variety and such non-existent diversity of gameplay I never got bored of the combat. It is fun, fluid and epic. It rewards aggression by granting you shields for each enemy killed through executions or perfect parries, and the ability to regen a bit of health lost to attacks if you're quick enough to retaliate. What isn't epic however is the un-inspired level-design, the lackluster repetition, and the horrid war of attrition that each mission eventually boils down to.
Each mission has a fixed layout and main objective, they don't change from match to match; instead, what does change is the placement of enemies, the number of them, and the amount required of each objective. Sometimes you'll be forced to place two bombs, another time you'll be forced to place five. And while this doesn't do a whole lot to shake the tedium of repetition, what it does do--however--is change the difficulty rather drastically. You can run into a couple of tiny one-shot guys one run, and a horde of huge, melee-focused guys another. And that would be fine if it wasn't for the limitations of their combat system. Because while it is fun, it is also rather limited in your ability to utilize it for your own survival. Like I said above, you can regen a bit of health lost if you're quick enough with a melee attack, and you can regain shields through executions or a shot to the head through the use of a perfect parry. What this does is promote an aggressive playstyle that rewards parries of the smaller enemies, and the executions of the larger ones. However, larger, melee-based elites don't give shields for perfect parries. And so, with the random spawns of enemies, you could find yourself surrounded by ten melee-based enemies and be unable to regain shields--meaning you'll watch your health dwindle and be unable to do anything about it. Worse, if you're then at the same time getting pummelled at range, which completely removes the ability to act quick enough that you regain a bit of lost health. Well, you can get better perks, of course. But that doesn't change that fact that random spikes in difficulty that skill cannot compensate for aren't fun; difficulty doesn't mean tediousness. And with a failed run meaning the potential loss of gathered upgrade materials, it being up to chance rather than skill is frustrating at best, and infuriating at worst. I'm not max level yet, and so maybe there are more perks to counteract such things, but it doesn't make the grind to get to max level any less annoying.

Class Progression is rather limited. You've no choice in what perk to begin with, meaning there's not really any build-variety. Weapon Progression offers a bit more variety, allowing you to choose whether you favour less speed and more damage, or vice versa.

Multiplayer is fine. It's a nice little relic of the early 2000s obsession with tacked-on versus modes. Little unbalanced, perhaps. But all the more nostalgic for it. It has a rather limited customisation-system. Grapple-hook dudes can use a Knife and a Sword but cannot use a power-fist. Shield-Bros can use a power-fist but cannot use a hammer, etc, etc. Fans might blame that on lore--but if that's the case, I don't really see why you'd offer customization at all. Better then to do perks, rather than equipment.

I do find it rather strange how unwelcoming the game is of newcomers. It doesn't go out of its way to ever explain any role, word or lore-based concept. And while one could argue that it is a game for fans, thinking that a Triple-A publisher would ever make a game of this size and not want to attract newcomers is downright naive. If you're not already a fan you'll either be real confused about a lot of what they're talking about, or you'll be spending half your playtime on the wiki. Overall it's a decent hack-and-slash-shooter that won't ever impress any non-Warhammer fan or person who enjoys a greater diversity of gameplay; it's all corridors and button-presses and horde-styled defence finales. But on the flip-side, it seems to be a delight for Warhammer fans; a crunchy, blood-soaked romp through a world of stainless steel and great, towering cathedrals, filled with horrid tech bonded with flesh, robot-skulls, and weapons galore, all of it in the Glorious name of the Emperor!
幽默制作组，我至今都搞不明白这种脑瘫制作组为什么这么热衷于在pve里削玩家，难不成玩家玩爽了等于把制作组的妈给干爽了？这么敏感？
这样，下个更新把榴弹和热熔也砍了，理由就是觉得玩家太依赖榴弹了，其他武器没有出场空间，这样一点也不酷，之后版本更新直播打N5 7图被三个立卡特背刺一刀狙虫一枪直接死3个翻车。然后再到社区来个工作人员和玩家互怼。面对差评如潮，做出60天更新的计划。

非锤粉7-7.5，锤粉8分
比较忠实还原8版前桌面普通SM生存情况的游戏，被AP-小枪小刀堆死，被AP2武器秒杀，本身爆弹S4 AP5谁都打不动，只有热熔和离子能打一下人，结果在走6寸上去的过程就被射爆了
说人话就是角色生存性能极差，血条不能回，医疗包有限，回血技能需要杀敌充能，白盾脆如纸，被摸一下就掉，处决和枪反只回1格。虽然处决变成了无敌但是整体生存能力反而比起一代是倒退的。远程武器除了激光大狙和热熔枪其他毫无杀伤力，近战武器出手慢攻速慢打到人之前就会被摸好几下，在小怪潮里游泳是根本不可能的，建议小怪直接用热熔喷死然后专心处理精英怪。
关卡设计又贼恶心，最难的反而是前几关，虫子的肉搏能力和远程能力都很强，近战有武士虫和刀虫海，远程还有枪虫海和枪武士虫，几个有脑虫的战点在最高难度下都是能让你死去活来的，主武器是热熔你就没办法处理脑虫和远程，但是不拿热熔你就没办法处理几个武士虫带刀虫海，只能说战役可能就是为了合作设计的，单人打AI队友基本上只能靠他们补刀不能期待他们优先击杀重要怪物，所以联机的话体验可能会好0.5分以上。
但是锤味够啊，你能见到特提恩见不到的帝国卫队大战泰伦，黎曼鲁斯坦克开火，奇美拉碾过刀虫，还有大头们站在毒刃旁边听演讲，政委处决逃兵，手电筒像雨点一样射向虫群！卧槽！这味道也太正了。哦什么呀这游戏原来叫星际战士2不叫帝国卫队2……
哎想特提恩的老乡了……

Another case of nerfing fun things and putting leashes on players in a PVE mode designed to have a power fantasy.

I guess Saber is unaware what happened with Helldivers 2, I just hope it doesn't take them as long to realize no one wants these changes. Limited ammo uses, sounds really dumb for heavies and snipers that rely on ammo but ok, tougher enemies, they already take 3/4 of the mag to get to the executable stage but ok.
-70% melta-bomb damage to bosses? It only has one use, and that was its designated purpose, what were you thinking? The worst offense being, putting the imaginary leash on teammates so if the need to restore armor is present it CANNOT be done unless teammates are nearby? Who thought that was a good decision, I would love to see how that idea was received in the board room if Saber even held a meeting for this design choice.
Either none of Saber plays their own game or they just wanted their player base to leave because playing one game would have told you that snipers, assaults, and vanguards tend to leave their allies to focus on damage dealers to help the team but now they are punished for doing so. Having to constantly check to see if your team is near you so you can restore your only source of replenish-able health is insanely stupid and means that if we use our ability to grapple, or jump pack to a distant enemy (which is what its class is literally SUPPOSED TO DO) we are punished for it by not receiving armor back.

This is Helldivers 2 treatment all over again with Publishers and Development not listening to their player base and not playing or experiencing their own nightmarish decisions and acting like it's what we've asked for all along. Thanks for the fun while it lasted Saber.

Very pretty, but if you're looking for interesting gameplay, look elsewhere.

The environments are very well designed and the graphics engine does an admirable job of bringing large hordes of enemies to life. The art team clearly loved this game and the wealth of visual inspiration found in the 40k universe makes for an environment that's consistently grimdark and occasionally breathtaking despite the dark, oppressive story beats.

However, the gameplay is too basic to remain entertaining for long. Melee is a one-button affair with a push-X-to-parry system that wants to draw comparisons to Arkham Knights but feels more like a "push X to not die" scene from a mid-2000s action game. You do not dictate the pace of combat and any aggression on your part is immediately punished with chip damage from ranged fire and minor foes on your flanks. That chip damage swiftly mounts into fatalities. You -must- parry and retaliate, exploiting the invulnerability allowed by the retaliation and execution animations to restore your armor, slowly wearing down swarms of foes at a pace that is simply out of character for Space Marines.

Guns are inaccurate unless you're aiming down sights, ammunition is sharply limited, and anything worth shooting is also either resilient enough to shrug off ranged fire or capable of blocking sniper rounds with a sword. If an ally engages an enemy you can pop off a few head shots to knock it into execution range, but for the most part you're better off wading into the melee horde yourself and tediously retaliating your way to victory.

The visual character customization is beautiful but harshly restricted and/or greedily monetized, the equipment specialization and character growth are slow and ineffectual until you get one of a the handful of major abilities scattered throughout a 25 level grind. Relics and other equipment make more of a difference visually than in combat effectiveness - an additional 10% damage doesn't take you from 6 heavy attacks to 5 to stun a warrior, but the max rank sword sure does look a little prettier than the starter sword.

To cap that all off, in multiplayer every player has to play as a different class - but you can't select your class and then queue into a team where you're not competing for that class spot. There's about a 1 in 3 chance that someone has already selected the class you want to play when you join a team, and you can't progress your class if you can't play it, so expect to have to leave and re-queue, sometimes multiple times in a row, in order to play a preferred class in multiplayer.

The final nail in the coffin, then, is that despite the shallowness of the gameplay and the general jank of the multiplayer system, this game is terribly short, confusingly lacking in content despite having so little depth. There are only six campaign missions, which have no replayability. The only other option for PvE are operations, but again, there are only six operations. This is a full-priced $60 game that you could finish in a day, that nonetheless expects you to grind out 48 mission completions with each class to unlock visual armor.
新更新完連線品質比之前還差，排了5場每場都排不進去，登陸時間還是一樣久，除非是戰錘粉絲要不然我不太推薦給不認識戰錘的人玩，等的時間都夠我打完手遊每日了。

Jogo maravilhoso, fluido, combate frenético, violência sem limites, combos e execuções fantásticos, muito ritmo nas batalhas, missões interessantes, ambientação do jogo é fantástica, principalmente na base dos Space Marines. É bem sinistro passar e olhar um Dreadnought e saber que tem um cara enterrado vivo ali dentro, sabendo que ele nunca mais vai sair de lá da sua tumba ambulante onde ele verá o mundo somente através de sensores e armado até os dentes e pronto para a batalha. O visual dos personagens é uma obra de arte, desde os detalhes da armadura até o brilho, cores e os desenhos e dizeres que ela contém. Jjogando em uma RTX 3060 + CPU Core i5 11400 F + SSD 1 TB NVME da Kingston, com tudo no Alto, Monitor Quad HD com DLSS ativado o jogo roda em 67/80 FPS sem stuttering. Não tive nenhuma experiência ruim com bugs no jogo, está rodando liso, sem falhas, pelo menos comigo a experiência foi boa. Joguei até a fase do Jump Pack, o que dá cerca de 4,5 horas de jogo. Cenários gigantescos e controles precisos (estou jogando com o dual sense do PS5) e dá pra sentir a sensação o peso da armadura do personagem, a sensação de quando corre, assim como o tiro das armas com os gatilhos adaptativos, o reload dos armamentos, os impactos das granadas numa batalha visceral e sangrenta, tudo para saciar a sede de quem quer um bom jogo de tiro, porrada e bomba contra os Aliens que continuam vindo incessantemente criando estratégias de ataque contra você, cercando pelos flancos e tudo mais, comandados por chefes, sub-chefes, batalhas épicas com Bosses, enfim, só tenho elogios para esse jogo. Comprei na pré-venda sem arrependimentos. Quem curte o Universo e a Lore de Warhammer 40K, vai se deliciar com cada segundo deste jogo. Violência a rodo para saciar a sede de quem ama jogos deste tipo. Recomendo muito a compra.
