Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs, I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!

Here are the ingredients you will need!

Ravioli Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 pinch salt, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 tablespoons water.

Ravioli Filling: 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese, 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup provolone cheese, shredded, 1 egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.

Pesto-Alfredo Cream Sauce: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce, 2 cups heavy cream, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.


1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil, 2 eggs, and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand; use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.

2. Knead the dough until smooth, 8 to 10 minutes; add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

3. While the dough is resting, prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese, egg, and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.

4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream, raise the heat to high, and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.

5. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, warm the marinara sauce over medium-low heat.

6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.

7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli, brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta, pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.

8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli, and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot, 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.

9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown, about 4 minutes.

10. To serve the ravioli, divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.

Bardzo dobra gra w imię Boga Imperatora. Przepotężna rzeźnia heretyckiego plugastwa i abominacji - flaki walają się wszędzie. Można też wydobyć ich jeszcze więcej, z pomocą miecza łańcuchowego, młota energetycznego czy bolterów. Astartes są potężni i to czuć oraz widać na każdym kroku. Niszczenie robactwa to czysta rozkosz, wykończenia są świetne i mega satysfakcjonujące. Graficznie gra też wygląda cudownie, momentami musiałem przystopować z misją żeby popodziwiać widoki. 9 godzin rozgrywki i nie miałem żadnego crasha, problemów z teksturami, czy czymkolwiek innym. Grę instalujesz, odpalasz i śmiga bez problemu, co teraz jest niestety rzadkością przy większości nowych tytułów. Cudowna jatka z wciągająca i trzymającą się kupy fabułą.
Imperator chroni.

Imagina que Gears Of War y World War Z hubieran tenido un hijo, un hijo al que le han inyectado esteroides en vena y lo han dotado de características como un combate brutal y visceral o un gunplay de los mejores que hemos tenido en lo que va de año.

Pues creo que esta es una de las descripciones que más se acerca a lo que es el concepto de Space Marine 2.

Un juego bastante redondo, con una buena campaña que se puede jugar en cooperativo (lo cual es un plus) aunque es verdad que la historia a partir de la mitad flojea un poco, no quiero entrar en spoilers pero el cambio de facción enemiga a mitad de juego parece que está un poco metido con calzador.

Un modo operaciones que está bastante bien y te anima bastante a jugarlo por que:

Primero: son misiones complementarias a las de la campaña, en los mismos entornos pero con otros lugares, soldados y objetivos. Como si de misiones secundarias se tratara pero orientadas al juego en equipo.

Segundo: tiene un sistema de clases y de progresión bastante adictivo, donde insta a jugar para desbloquear mejoras de personaje, mejoras de arma y aspectos de ambos, ya que se consiguen puntos para hacer progreso en las heráldicas o comprar nuevas habilidades de las clases con subidas de nivel.

Tercero: Son rejugables en cierta medida gracias a que tienen un poco de aleatoriedad como pasa en Warhammer 40.000 Darktide, con spawns random de oleadas, minibosses y cambios de objetos, RNG de items etc.

En cuanto al multijugador yo lo he encontrado bastante decepcionante por diversas razones.

La primera de todas es que son Arenas, que te da la sensación de jugar una mezcla rara entre un "Gears" multiplayer y un hero shooter por el tema de las habilidades de las clases.

Los mapas son pequeños, algo laberínticos y cerrados, a mí en lo personal me recuerdan mucho más a estar jugando a Quake/DooM arena que a otra cosa y la verdad es que es una formula que no me termina de convencer en un juego donde se juega en 3a persona y en el que los personajes creo que no son los idóneos para este tipo de mapas, creo que hubiera sido un acierto mucho más grande el hacerlo un multijugador más "tradicional" o con un concepto algo más a lo titanfall, con PvPvE que tenga marines como jugadores y soldados normales controlados por IA, al menos yo creo que hubiera sido una experiencia mucho más disfrutable.

Al menos me da la sensación de que el juego no tiene SBMM y es algo de agradecer, el ping es bastante parejo así que me da la sensación de que el juego busca por conexión (eso si, el sistema de emparejamiento, no balancea ni aunque sea solamente un poco, en serio, de 10 partidas no he podido ganar ni una, no es normal la cantidad de pedazo de mancos que te tocan en un equipo, que yo no soy ningún pro, pero consigo quedar con proporciones de 1.0-1.2 cuando tengo compañeros que tienen 0.1 es decir matar 1 y morir 8-9 veces)

En cuanto a nivel técnico es bastante sublime, tiene un motor gráfico propietario de Saber Interactive que ya hemos visto en World War Z que tiene un rendimiento y un desempeño como pocos, en serio, pocos motores pueden mover tanto enemigo con tanto lujo de detalle y viendose tan bien con un rendimiento tan fluido (y me muero de ganas de que portee a Vulkan como en WWZ que te da sin problemas para jugar en ultra a 180fps seguro)

El sistema de combate cuerpo a cuerpo es muy bueno, con los combos y las esquivas, contraataques etc. El de combate a distancia ya si es algo más normalito y no tiene nada destacable o mencionable frente a cualquier otro shooter, no innova en nada a diferencia del CaC.

Igualmente es un juego bastante redondo, ya digo que tiene algunas carencias en mi opinión, cosas que creo que le faltan (que imagino que se irán añadiendo con el tiempo) como algunas armas o facciones ya que la selección de armas es muy pobre y todas se sienten muy parecidas salvo 2 o 3 y JODER DONDE ESTÁN LAS ESCOPETAS, en serio, no se si es que nadie las ha echado en falta o que, pero por si os habéis dado cuenta no hay escopetas (y las hay en el elenco de armas del imperio) ya no hablo de que metan las porras o hachas de energía (que no estaría mal ya que el juego solo tiene 3 melés) pero es que me hace gracia que tienes como 7 rifles bólter que son el mismo arma con modos de fuego diferentes, 3 pistolas, 2 sniper y 2 armas de energía.... lo cual me parece un repertorio un poco pobre la verdad.

Otra cosa mala para mi es el multijugador, el de PVP, en serio, me parece lo peor que tiene el juego con diferencia, eso de que sean arenas pequeñas en vez de campos de batalla con multitudes de enemigos que es lo que representa al universo, me parece un FAIL de manual (en mi humilde opinión) por que si algo caracteriza al universo de WH40K es lo masivo de sus guerras y sus ejércitos, y para mi eso no se ve representado en un mapa canijo en el que se juega un 6vs6 o un 8vs8 etc.

Si te gustan los juegos de Hordas y la ambientación de WH40K adelante, es un muy buen juego, me atrevo a decir que una de las mejores entregas que hemos visto y vamos a ver este 2024, si os gusta el universo, otra joya que veo indispensable es WH40K Darktide donde vais a ver en 1a persona el lado de un soldado en vez del de un marine espacial, además de que se complementa muy bien con Space Marine 2 por que el juego se desarrolla en otros entornos y contra otras facciones como la plaga de Nurgle.

No soy muy de poner notas a un juego y menos de lanzamiento cuando tiene todo el contenido post-lanzamiento por delante pero le daría un 7,5-8/10 a Space Marine 2 y no más por que para mi falla bastante en el Multijugador PVP, de verdad que me parece el peor modo del juego y lo que más trabajo necesita para estar a la altura del resto del juego, es un modo bastante olvidable que no aporta nada al núcleo del juego. No innova en nada, y ni siquiera diría que es divertido, lo veo anticuado y fuera de esta época como concepto y como modo de juego, en cuanto al resto del título 10/10.

Es kommt trotzdem ein ABER:

ABER ich bin kein Fan dieses Franchises und habe mir so gut wie nichts vorher angesehen, durchgelesen oder angehört und muss einfach, nachdem ich die Story mit einem Kollegen im Koop durchgespielt habe zum Schluss kommen:
Für jemanden der sich im Warhammer 40k Universum kaum bis gar nicht auskennt, bleibt am Ende bis auf ein gutes Action-Spiel gar nichts übrig.

Die Story wird man nicht verstehen, bei den Charakteren weiß man nicht wer wer ist oder welcher Rang jetzt was ist und so weiter und so weiter. Es bleibt einem einfach nur Ballern Ballern Ballern.

Und ich bin der festen Meinung, das ist auch jedes Mal der Genickbruch dieses eigentlich sehr interessanten Universums. Es reicht in meinen Augen einfach nicht aus, wenn man ab und zu mal Namen nennt, die einem vielleicht gar nichts sagen, dann für sich stehen und dann nicht weiter thematisiert werden.
Ich habe nach Teil 2 erst einmal den ersten Teil gespielt um zu gucken, ob ich einen WOW oder AHA Effekt bekomme, aber es ist in Teil 1 ja noch schlimmer mit den für mich nichts aussagenden Einwürfen von Namen.

Wenn ich eine Lore oder ein Universum erst "Studieren" muss um eine Story eines einzelnen Spiels zu verstehen, dann ist die verdammt noch mal nicht gut oder nicht gut rübergebracht.
Dann ist es einzig und alleine Fanservice und ob das für die breite Masse ausreicht, da habe ich meine Zweifel.

Trotzdem hatte und wer ich noch Spaß an diesem Spiel haben, so das eine Empfehlung trotz für mich nicht existierender Story noch gerade so gegeben ist.

Battle Report: Space Marines 2

From the Desk of Brother-Sergeant Gabriel, 3rd Company, Ultramarines Chapter

Mission Log: 15 Hours In, Campaign Complete

Hail, Brothers and Sisters of the Imperium,

The long-awaited call to arms has been answered. Space Marines 2 has descended upon us like a righteous storm, and after dedicating a solid 15 hours to its campaign and accessories, it is time to deliver our verdict.

Space Marines 2 has risen to meet the high expectations set by its predecessor and then some. The narrative, steeped in the grimdark lore of the 40K universe, unfolds with the gravitas expected of our sacred battlefields. Each mission is a crucible of intensity, keeping the Emperor’s light blazing as you face the myriad horrors that plague the galaxy. The campaign's storyline is robust, providing a compelling blend of heroism and tragedy that befits the grand saga of the Space Marines.

Combat is a symphony of visceral destruction, every engagement a testament to the might of the Adeptus Astartes. The bolter’s roar and the chain sword's hum are rendered with such fidelity that it feels as though you’re wielding these sacred relics yourself. The enemies are varied and formidable, challenging even the most seasoned warriors among us. The improved AI ensures that no battle is ever truly predictable, demanding tactical acumen and reflexes as sharp as a power sword.

Graphically, the game captures the dark majesty of the 40K universe with hauntingly beautiful environments and detailed character models. The ambiance is as oppressive as a Space Hulk, with every setting dripping in the atmosphere of an Imperium on the brink.

In terms of gameplay, the enhancements to combat mechanics and the new abilities granted to our esteemed warriors are noteworthy. The balance between raw power and strategic depth has been finely tuned, allowing us to crush the xenos and heretics with righteous fury.

However, the path of the righteous is not without its trials. There are moments when the mission design feels somewhat formulaic, and a few technical hiccups mar the otherwise flawless execution of this grand endeavor. Yet, these are but minor blemishes on an otherwise gleaming armor of excellence.

In conclusion, Space Marines 2 stands as a proud addition to the legacy of the Warhammer 40K series. It honors our tradition of battle while forging a new path with unwavering zeal. For those who walk the line of the Emperor’s light, this is a battle worth engaging in.

In the Emperor's Name,

Рецепт сырного супа:
- Куриное филе моем и нарезаем кусочками. Кладем в кастрюлю, заливаем водой и ставим на плиту.
- Пока варится мясо, чистим лук и нарезаем мелкими кусочками.
- Морковь чистим и натираем на крупной терке. Делаем зажарку из лука и моркови.
- Пока готовится зажарка, чистим и нарезаем картофель. Бросаем вариться к мясу готовую зажарку и нарезанный картофель.
- Нарезаем сыр кубиками (не покупайте дешевый сыр, он не растворится у вас в супе).
- Мелко нарезаем помытую зелень.
- Через 10 минут после того, как бросили вариться картофель, добавляем в куриный суп вермишель и варим еще 5 мин.
- Добавляем в суп с вермишелью соль и специи. Добавляем плавленые сырки и варим сырный суп до полного растворения сыра. Когда сыр растворится, добавляем зелень и снимаем куриный суп с плавленым сыром с огня.


А игра 10 из 10, да.

Very fun gameplay but not worth the $60 they are charging

The campaign takes about 6 to 7 hours to beat which is alright but you don't make any progress towards your classes or weapons in it which is REALLY dumb, the main thing people are going to be doing is trying to is level up their classes to be able unlock armor to make your character look good. The Operations mode is the only mode where you can grind for class levels but sadly there are only 6 missions which they expect you to grind over and over again but in 4 difficulties for 6 classes and 25 levels each. The PvP has it's own leveling system for some reason instead of just going off the operations levels and making it another source of leveling classes. Other than that it's an unbalanced pvp mode with only 3 modes and 3 maps that seems to be added as an after thought.

Could of been GOTY worthy cause of the PvE gameplay if it wasn't for the lack of content, poor performance, bugs, glitches and $60 price tag. I am glad I only paid $49 for this game but even then I feel as if it should have been $30 for the content it has right now.

Some things I like about this is no battlepass and no in game shop. Plus all the content they plan to add is going to be free, so eventually it will have enough content to warrant the $60 price tag.

Buy it during a sale!

Space Marine 2 is a good example of what we've lost due to games as a service and predatory monetization schemes, with videogames whose sole purpose of development is to serve as a cosmetics and skins virtual store.
Saber has transported me back to the first decade of the 2000s when video games were just art and pure entertainment. For sure this is not a perfect game, but it is certainly a great one. A solid campaign, cooperative mode and a multiplayer mode, which is simple, but very fun and entertaining, with a progression system and lots of rewards to unlock for free. Just like in the good ol' days.
How good it feels to be able to play a video game with no developer-generated fomo to encourage battle passes sales, with a clear roadmap before release, no microtransactions and no in-game store.
Space Marine 2 is visually amazing with stunning graphics, the combat system is smooth and action packed with a blood and gore feast. I'm playing it on a 3080 with no problems or bugs so far, but I think they can optimize the game even more for my fellow brothers who don't own a beefy GPU.
The Emperor has delivered. The Emperor will provide. For the Emperor!

"Courage and Honour!"

Space Marine II - это то за что все любили и любят компьютерные игры. Взяли брутальную вселенную, красиво ее воплотили на экране, насытили большим количеством "вау моментов", дали большие пушки, мечи и "солдатиков", сдобрили это кооперативом и мультиплеером, который имеет высокую реиграбельность и позволяет вместе с друзьями крушить черепа, а в конце написали сюжет. Что в итоге? Получили главный боевик начала осени, если не всего 2024 года.

При этом игра не пытается быть какой-то очень продуманной и не вываливает на игрока тонны информации по прокачке персонажа, механиках или тонкостях сюжета. Хотя это все есть, но подача настолько проста, что ее можно описать так: "Вот меч, вот пушка. Знаешь, что с этим делать? Тогда вперед!". Все гениальное просто.

Для тех же кто является еще и любителем (для меня в частности) вселенной Warhammer: 40.000 эта игра праздник посреди сентября. Такого тщательного воплощения всех деталей я не видел ни в одной игре по лецензии Games Workshop. Каждый пиксель в этой игре дышит и передает дух этого мрачного, гротекстного и захватывающего мира. Каждый космодесантник, каждый гвардеец, каждый тиранид и хаосит нарисованы с такой любовь, что невольно думаешь будто Saber Interactive всем офисом стали расписывать миниатюры для настолки и читать кодекс. Игра сделанa с огромным вниманием к деталям и любовью. Фотомод здесь это один из моих любимых режимов!

И что в итоге? Без каких-то либо откровений и изобретаний велосипеда мы получаем экшен, который выполняет свою цель на 200% - увлекает, развлекает и доставляет удовольствие. Это тот Warhammer: 40.000, который мы заслужили!

"In the grim darkness of the far future, there is only war"

From the moment you step into your power armor, you’re no longer just a human, you’re a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ walking cathedral of destruction, blessed by the Emperor’s divine will. Xenos? Heretics? Chaos-worshipping filth? They’re not your enemies, they’re your next target practice. Reload, deliver, and repeat until the galaxy is cleansed.

The Combat
It’s pure, undiluted rage made flesh. You don’t just kill your enemies, you annihilate them with every pull of the trigger, as if the Emperor himself is screaming “Purge harder!” in your ears!

It's simple, if it’s not human, it dies. You don’t need context or a reason; they’re xenos, they exist, that’s enough to condemn them. You are the Emperor’s fist, and the galaxy is your punching bag.

Warhammer Space Marine 2 ist ein fantastisches Spiel, das in fast allen Bereichen überzeugt. Die Grafik ist beeindruckend, die Sounds sind stimmig, und die Waffen fühlen sich einfach großartig an. Ich habe die Kampagne auf der höchsten Schwierigkeit durchgespielt und aktuell zwei Charaktere – einen Verteidiger und einen Zerstörer – auf Level 25.

Die Kampagne ist hervorragend umgesetzt und fängt die düstere, epische Atmosphäre von Warhammer perfekt ein. Man fühlt sich wirklich wie ein Teil dieses riesigen Universums – einfach fantastisch. Auch die Koop-Missionen sind sehr gelungen und machen eine Menge Spaß, allerdings sind die Chaos-Missionen noch etwas unausgewogen.

Der PvP-Modus ist unterhaltsam, aber es gibt noch Luft nach oben. Mit nur drei Spielmodi und etwa fünf Maps ist das Angebot noch recht begrenzt. Zudem fehlt es den Chaos Marines an Anpassungsoptionen, was dem PvP etwas an Tiefe nimmt. Hier sehe ich die größte Schwäche des Spiels.

Das Spiel läuft außerdem extrem stabil. In meiner gesamten Spielzeit hatte ich nur einen einzigen Bug, aber keinen Absturz oder sonstige Probleme – es ist wirklich sehr gut optimiert.

An alle, die sich beschweren, dass es keine Pronomen, Frauen, LGBTQ+ oder andere Repräsentationen gibt: Im echten Leben könnt ihr all das gerne so ausleben, wie ihr wollt, aber in Warhammer geht es nur um Krieg! Lasst das Universum so, wie es seit den 90ern ist. Wenn es euch nicht passt, sucht euch bitte etwas anderes und lasst uns unser Warhammer so lieben, wie es ist: düster und gnadenlos. DARK and GRIM.

Trotz kleinerer Mängel ist Warhammer Space Marine 2 ein großartiges Spiel, das ich jedem Fan des Universums oder Action-Gamern wärmstens empfehlen kann.

O jogo não vale R$200,00.
Pagaria no máximo R$100,00 por ele.

* O jogo está extremamente repetitivo, apenas 6 mapas para um farm gigantesco.

* A quantidade de bosses no jogo é mínima, e praticamente todos tem as mesmas skills.

* O jogo não tem um equilíbrio descente entre os mobs, seja minions ou mobs maiores. Os minions dão dano igual ou superior ao dos bichos maiores.

* O jogo não te da informação suficiente relacionado as evoluções das armas, deixando um limbo gigantesco nesse sentido.

* As informações sobre o poder de fogo das armas não parece estar certo. Você coloca elas no lvl máximo e quando usa elas em lvls mais baixos, preciso dar a mesma qtdade de tiros ainda para matar os mobs.

* O esquema de esquiva e bloqueio do jogo precisa ser aperfeiçoado.

* A skill do assaulto está uma avacalhação, as vezes funciona, as vezes não. O que acaba te levando a morte em algumas situações no jogo.

* Ou você joga com a arma melta, ou você não faz conteúdo endgame.

* Assault tem uma vantagem que diz: Ao realizar ataques carregados, vc n perde o controle ao sofrer golpes pesados e não pode ser empurrado. Mesmo com essa skill ativa, vc é empurrado e perde o controle TODA VEZ, inclusive por minions.

* Os níveis de dificuldade deveriam ter um lvl mínimo para entrar. Muito player querendo rushar lvl e querendo ser carregado em dificuldade mais alta. Atrapalha demais o jogo ao invés de ajudar.

I have almost 70 hours in almost a week. And by the Emperor, I am going to have so much more.

The game may not be for everyone, but if getting in a skin of an armour-clad super-soldier facing an innumerable horde of alien monstrosities that will try to rip you apart sounds at least somewhat appealing, I would recommend you to try it.

Otherwise, it is not the best game ever made, I'd even say it's rather simple, almost old-school style game, with meaty visuals and a straightforward but captivating gameplay. Whether you find this enticing is up to you, my friend.

"In their arrogant suspicion, the Inquisition failed to recognise the truth, that no evil will ever overcome a devotion such as yours."

In around 9 hours of campaign the devs manage to pack so much story, so much lore, so much fun that it looks and feels like a XBOX 360 Game, by that i mean the best possible compliment i can think of, by that i mean that this game is simply tons of fun, the story is so simple yet so well done, its something in the likes of "brothership, thrust, hardship, and overcoming the odds", it doesn't need to be complex, it is a world of chaos, disgrace and corruption, and you, together with your brothers will punish the herectics responsible for this mess, easy and as i said, well done, this if by far one of the most fun and most enjoyable games i've played recently. I only wanted to say a few words but... Well, just go and play the damn game! And don't forget, GLORY TO ULTRAMAR!!

Это больше, чем я ожидала, и даже больше, чем надеялась. Такой игра по Вархаммеру и должна быть: пафос стекает с экрана, броманс во все поля, эпичность происходящего вокруг зашкаливает. Гештальты концовки первой части закрыты и перекрыты. Постановка — моё почтение. Фанат во мне бьётся в экзальтации и захлёбывается от того, что додали недоданного лет за десять разом. Есть атмосфера и ощущение масштаба происходящего, что твои действия часть большой воинской операции Ордена, и это просто офигенно.
Игра мясная, динамичная, ощущение от инсектоцида — 10 из 10 на кончиках пальцев, так не радовалась, когда тараканов с кухни извела.

Багов не заметила особо, но я везучая. Оптимизация.... с учетом, сколько моделей я видела на экране одновременно и мурмурацией летучих тиранид, она отличная.

Рекомендую. Но с боевыми братьями сильно лучше.

This game knows exactly what it represents and doesn't shy away from doing so. They know exactly who the target audience is. Just from the tutorial alone, I could tell that this was a game made by fans for fans of the franchise. So much love and care went into it. It's 2024 and they don't make games like this anymore where Masculinity, Honor, Duty, Loyalty, Comradery and Brotherhood are depicted in such a captivating and influential way. These are qualities that the modern world and the modern game's industry forgot about. This is Warhammer and it remains true and unapologetic to its identity. They absolutely nailed it.

Warhammer 40000: Space Marines II Is a fantastic game.
The characters in Warhammer 40000: Space Marines II are not just part of the story; they are the story. Each one is uniquely developed, with its own distinct personality that adds depth and complexity to the narrative.
The main character, Titus, what can I say? He is just a chad; no other word can describe him. He rises to the challenge no matter what, with his unwavering faith in the Imperium of man and the Emperor.
The story was fantastic, well done, and filled with epic moments that make you goosebumps.

Giving this game a 9/10

Attention mesdames et messieurs, il s'agit d'un jeu COMPLET !
Hé oui vous ne rêvez pas, c'est arrivé. Terminé la campagne, fais toutes les ops en multi et tout ça sans un seul bug, sans un crash ou glitch en tout genre, déjà gros positif pour ça. Et dire que c'était la norme avant ... aujourd'hui c'est révolu mais Saber l'a fait donc on peut les en remercier (je vais essayer de donner le max de détails sans m'attarder ci-dessous mais pas évident car il propose beaucoup pour un jeu dès sa sortie)

Dans son ensemble, le jeu est assez dingue :
- graphisme : ça claque, rien à dire. Petit +, je vous invite à faire joujou avec le module "photo" dans le menu une fois en game, je vous promets une belle surprise. C'est simple j'ai un nouveau wallpaper 4K :)
- gameplay : on sent la puissance du/des personnages incarnés et des armes utilisées. Peu paraitre assez lent sur certaines actions (notamment corps à corps) pour quelques uns mais ça respecte assez bien le fait qu'on joue un soldat en hyper blindage faut pas l'oublier quand même ... et bien que lente, une attaque chargée de marteau ne vous décevra jamais, plaisir garantit. Et je ne vous parle pas des contres et finishers, mama!
- campagne : riche et variée, histoire travaillée et scénario qui en vaut la peine, certaines scènes sont assez épiques, immersives et vous prendront aux tripes. (exemple: quand on vous dira invasion, ça ne sera pas 3 petits et 1 moyen qui vous sauteront dessus ou dans le paysage mais bien une nuée en route pour vous démolir). +- 10h de jeu sans tryhard.
- autres actis : le PVP j'ai pas test mais pas trop mon truc de base donc on verra. Les ops en coop sont variées également, il y en a 8 pour l'instant et elles vous promettent un très beau challenge. Il y a 4 (5?) niveaux de difficultés et déjà le 2 c'est vraiment pas de la tarte ... donc de belles heures de gameplay en perspective.
- progression : point à lui tout seul tellement ce dernier a été développé. Je vous invite à aller voir des vidéos là dessus sur youtube si vous voulez plus de détails car c'est déjà bien poussé (darktide c'est du flan à côté) mais en gros, il y a pour l'instant 6 classes jouables, chacune ayant sa compétence active (1 par classe, un "ulti") et des passives bien distinctes, qui sont à monter avec de l'expérience acquise en combat. A côté de ça, il y a l'équipement (certains étant spécifiques par classe, je pense par exemple au bolter lourd réservé pour la classe lourde uniquement .. oui oui je sais j'ai fait la même tête) avec sa courbe de progression pour chaque arme. Bonus passif, versions améliorées, .. you name it ! + non négligeable, il est possible qu'une même arme soit utilisée par plusieurs classes, sa progression est partagée à travers toutes ces dernières. Vous ne devez donc pas la remonter de 0 en changeant de classes, malin !
- personnalisation : last but not least comme disent les anglais! Gros catalogue de personnalisation couleur avec toutes les pièces de votre armure modifiables individuellement. Et tout ça ? Juste avec de la monnaie in game, pas possible avec de l'argent réel. Un plaisir.

Donc:
Grand OUI pour le jeu, foncez et partagez la démocratie de l'Empereur ;) . Seul petit négatif potentiel, les missions pourraient devenir répétitives à la longue pour atteindre les niveaux les plus hauts, à voir ... moi pour l'instant je ne le ressens pas.

Bonus:
Quelle version choisir ?
J'ai pris l'ultra édition mais je ne pense pas que le cosmétique offert en vaille vraiment la peine.. par contre le season pass aucune idée de comment cela va se dérouler donc à vous de voir ... mais si le contenu futur est dans la lignée de ce qui est déjà proposé, ça ne sera pas une perte.
Игра не без проблем, сможете прочитать о них в отрицательных отзывах, но для меня это 100 на 10, а последние полтора часа это вообще сплошной визуальный оргазм фанбоя вахи40к.

As a Warhammer fan, the art, the design, just everything pleasing to the eye

As a GAME, this game is overhyped and overpriced. Outdated gameplay that didn't innovate in any sense of the word. I'm disappointed that this was literally just sm1 with better graphics. The content is extremely lacking, 6 repetitive missions with repetitive gameplay to boot. It's better to buy on sale for those who don't wanna read everything.

- Story:
It's brief, generic, and forgettable. The plot is more generic slop comparable to a call of duty campaign so don't expect too much there. The story is effectively glaze central for the BLUEBERRIES then omg secret bad guy plot out of nowhere instead of Tyranids being the main focus, diverting from the more interesting developments that could've been. Wish there was more focus with the marines themselves instead of lol chaos again.

- Lack of various QoL options like FOV sliders.
Not enough graphics options to disable features like post processing effects or light sensitive features, Lack of support of various monitors, Motion blur literally doesn't go off when you set it to off, the list goes on. The game can be a disco show at times, giving me headache on top of only being able to see my character's GIANT ASS cheeks lawd haf murthy.

- Clunky movement and unresponsive actions at times
Dodge is horribly delayed, not many ways to cancel out of animations.
There's these weird moments where you stand still thinking you'd dodge and you may say to yourself "what i dodged what the heck" well I'm here to tell you you're not CRAZY. The dodge is hard coded to buffer sprint as an action on PC, resulting into delay actions because of the buffer option select between dodge and sprinting. Extremely ass cheeks.

- Clunky Melee and Ranged Combat.
Aimming feels stiff due to the options for sens being so limited. But for the most part the clunkiness comes from how underpowered the weapons are. There's about 4 usable guns i can think of in my head. The sound design is lacking for some weapons and don't pack the resounding WALLOP that Bolter has in other games. Then the crosshair bloom just makes weapons feels so off and boorish that's not even worth shooting half the time cause you can't hit the board side of a barn. Melee which I was hoping to be different enough to entice ultimately falls short dude to the lack animation cancels for dodge and more. You end up parrying everything as much as possible for it is the only way to cancel, downside being you're standing still to get peppered by bullets. I hope it changes.

- Overly reliant on "QTEs" or executions or deadshots
Now that know this may not seem like an issue at first but when you realize these are the only ways to regen armor during combat it becomes glaring. It's cool to see the first 20 times but after 3 hours you'll wish there were introduce more ways to engage with regen. Standing still doing a cool animation with a camera interrupts the flow of gameplay and adds to the clunkiness of the game. The lack of ways to regain armor is astounding. THEY REALLY want you to abuse executions and deadshots as much as possible cause of the iframes executions give you. I wish the game would encourage aggressively slashing my enemies instead of having to watch an animation play for 500th time.

- Overly reliant on off screen indicators
This is the same problem i had with god of war 2018 where the fov was so low that had to see my characters HUGE ASS BACK. Constantly taking backshots from tyranids because i have to look at the funny circle around my character and press the button. It's lazy to me and makes combat feel unfocused.

- Difficulties are badly designed
One sentence, increasing health and damage and nothing is bad difficult design.
Bullet Sponges put people to sleep stop this ♥♥♥♥. Really throws the balance out of whack.

- Content is lacking and the game is highly repetitive
I can't be bothered to play the same 6 missions over and over again that hardly vary enough to be noticable. There's not much to say because of the game not having content on release. The only way they tend to vary is "place X amount of bombs" objectives change the number of bomb. Again how is this game 60 bucks?

I really wanted to like this game but it's just an outdated action game to me.

I'm sleepy as ♥♥♥♥ when i made this review so i may have missed some points i wanted to make. But don't buy right now wait for sale.

EDIT 17/10/24: Yeah I'm done with this game.
This roadmap is actually horrible.
1 New mission when we only have 6 in the game is baffling. 1 new weapon is cool i guess.

But the biggest kicker of the whole thing is the obvious malice against modding. They essentially killed modding this update. The only thing keeping the game on life support for me. I enjoyed cosplaying the deathwatch, using various weapons with different classes in pve, AND FINALLY HAVING FOV IN THE GAME, it was a good time. Instead of saber embracing this part of the community, they've effectively killed it off for good this time. Don't let the shills tell you this game is a good faith game. It's not. It's more marine slop core. I'm sure the designers and most devs were very passionate about making the game, but some of the higher ups definitely didn't understand the game's fanbase.

前言
《战锤40k：星际战士2》作为2011年《Space Marine》的续作，作为可以单人或多人进行游玩的快节奏第三人称战斗，你将在其中扮演回归极限战士队列的副官德米特里安·泰图斯，通过史诗级的战斗再次击退你的敌人并揭露真相。
游戏有着四种可选难度，并且在开始游戏前也可以绑定官方账号，从而领取限定奖励，头盔等皮肤，游戏背景则是在四十一千年人类濒临灭绝时期，银河系的人类帝国面临了异种袭击，而故事也由此展开了，游戏支持中文以及中文配音，当然你也可以体验英文配音只要记得打开字幕。
音画初见
不知名的植物叶脉分明，钢铁铸就的设施被虫巢占据破坏，碎石与鲜血布满地面，前进的道路上也有着障碍互动，可以踢开挡路的土堆扛起巨石等等，虫群随着病毒发射数以万计向你涌来，盔甲厚重保护着人体，骷髅与翅膀，死亡与生存，当你行动起来，被护甲包裹能听到机械摩擦的质感，你孤身一人为了人类生存而战。
该游戏采用了3D的画面塑造，在人物建模以及环境表现上十分优秀，序章你将操控与飞船失联的杀戮小队队长在庞大异形虫族的袭击中感受星际战争的震撼场面，在恰到好处的BGM中感受爆炸与鲜血，了解教程上手的同时，感受其中的紧张与刺激，当然对话时的剧情信息更是充满了吸引力。
第三人称视角下可以使用键鼠或者手柄，这里个人使用的是键鼠操作，攻击和重击都是一个按键，差别是按下和按住，按下会进行一个三次攻击连招，三次之后会出现一个间隔，按住则可以对抗大群敌人且按住时间越长重击威力越大。
你受到伤害会消耗护甲，护甲会在一小段间隔后恢复，短期内失去生命值可以通过造成伤害来恢复，同时设计了招架和完美招架可以立即击杀小型敌人使大型敌人陷入僵直状态的防御机制，可以闪避无法招架攻击以及对倒下敌人施展终结技处决以及使用技能等战斗元素，增加战斗爽快感。
在拿到枪械之后可以利用鼠标中键是瞄准，左键射击，在近距离战斗中可以结合重击来标记敌人施加强袭击杀小型敌人甚至对大型敌人造成大量伤害，同时场景内也有着补充弹药以及拿到可投掷榴弹等可收集使用。
星际战士大战外星异种，当序章过去，你便可以开启你的在线模式，进行单人或者多人战役，通过编辑小队来邀请你的朋友组成一只三人小队，最有趣的是载入游戏时你能在飞船内部看到任务栏，这里不得不再提一句，游戏的过场CG以及配音都十分精彩，贴合剧情。
战斗开始会有一个可以选择武器的设施，你可以在这里挑选你想要利用的枪械和进展武器，比如爆失卡宾枪、战斗刀等等，战役中能够找到数据板来听取音频日志，你可以在武器厅更换你的配装，当然战役或者任务时会对一些武器有所限制。
游戏分为PVE和PVP模式，你可以通过行动进行任务战役的PVE模式，体验剧情的同时获取经验、点数以及可发现的武器数据等奖励，而永恒战争则是PVP模式，可以通过快速比赛加入小队随机开始PVP，基本就是占领、夺取以及歼灭等不同元素。这里建议主线完成之后在进行其他可能剧透的模式体验从而解锁更多技能和装扮。
作为快节奏第三人称动作游戏，你可以在游戏中进行单人和多人的在线作战，支持PVE和PVP模式，并且有六种不同特长的职业可以进行升级从而解锁新的技能以及装备，优秀的剧情CG和音画表现加上炫酷的特效塑造了精彩的视觉表现，而快节奏的战役任务也在多种武器和技能的结合下呈现了爽快的射击动作体验，趣味性和挑战性十足，推荐给感兴趣的朋友。

Product received for free

Gioco devastante se sei un amante dell'ultraviolenza, delle orde di alieni incazzati e di Warhammer 40k.
Qui la mia recensione completa:
YouTube™ Video: Warhammer 40.000 Space Marine 2: RECENSIONE 
Views: 38,730
my honour is my loyalty
二周目真结局是转生成黄金王座猛吸帝皇沟子，大家快点来玩

Positives:
- Some of the best graphics around
- Wonderful melee combat and good gun combat to
- Voice acting is done well
- Music and other audio is done good
- Decent story
- A great lean and very fun campaign with no filler
- Performance for me was good the whole game, never below 60fps w everything cranked
- No crashes during the whole campaign
- Addicting gameplay
- Atmosphere is great, with so many enemies around feels like a real war
- Fun Coop
- No BS in the game, just a good old fashioned kicking ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ videogame
- Level design is awesome
- TONS of enemies everywhere!

Negatives:
- Campaign could have had another mission or 2
- The only mission I didn't like was the flying around in space, although short it wasn't needed
- Please allow people to have the same class in COOP, very annoying to have to switch


These are my thoughts so far after only beating the campaign, going to try some Coop next and maybe a little PVP but I don't see myself playing a ton of that. I will def be coming back to this game to in the future when more Coop missions are added and especially when the Horde mode is added, that should be wonderful fun with how good this combat system is.

Def one of the best Warhammer games to date, probably tied with GOW2 as my favorite all time Warhammer game and has made me reinstall GOW2, Hired Gun & Darktide again to get some more Warhammer action in, very good game and one of 2024's best without a doubt (Probably #3 on my top 10 list this year).

I do love my big epic, super long rpgs but I do love when a well done lean and mean campaign comes around that is about 7-8 hours and very well done. No filler, no extra bs, just get down to business and that is alot of fun. Well done to the devs, they nailed the Warhammer feel very well. As good as the first Space Marine game was, this is a good deal better imo, better graphics, combat is better and it has a more epic feel to it. Pretty much Space Marine 1 with classic Gears of War mix in, fantastic campaign overall.

Autant être honnête, c'est la première évaluation que je fais de ma vie sur Steam. Mais j'y suis bien obligé. Je me suis pris une claque MONUMENTALE.

Que dire. N'étant qu'aux prémices de l'Hérésie d'Horus, j'avais quelques réserves quand à ce jeu : ne pas pouvoir profiter pleinement de l'univers et de ce qu'il avait à proposer. Ne pas tout comprendre. Quelle erreur. C'est beau, c'est bien fait, c'est efficace.

Ce jeu prend tout son sens en multijoueur : affronter des légions d'hérétiques ou des hordes de xénos avec de parfaits inconnus, ou des amis, c'est le pied TOTAL. On en redemande, et on en à JAMAIS assez de faire exploser des cranes d'aliens à coup de bolters. On est surpuissant, mais très vite submergé. Relever un allié au sol avant de repartir au combat a ses cotés n'a jamais été aussi épique. La sensation de tir est jouissive. Les finish sont bien gore, et on adore découper en deux ce qui nous tombe sous le gantelet énergétique.

Toujours lutter de toutes ses forces jusqu'au dernier ennemi, par ce qu'à l'arrivée, il y a toujours quelque chose à débloquer. Une couleur, un élément d'armure, une amélioration d'arme. Cela faisait des années, pour moi, que je n'avais plus connu ce légendaire "aller, une dernière partie". Et ça marche, par ce que l'on fini toujours par en relancer une.

C'est addictif. C'est un chef d'oeuvre en la matière. Space Marine 2, Saber et Focus donnent une sacré leçon aux autres studios qui, depuis quelques années, se reposent sur des acquis bancals et sur des lauriers devenus immérités.

On ne peut que IMPLORER à genoux le studio d'entretenir son jeu, d'apporter des nouveautés et des ajouts réguliers, car des pépites pareilles, ce n'est pas tout les jours que ça sort sur le devant de la scène vidéo ludique.

Tirons notre chapeau à Saber Interactive et à Focus Entertainment. Du fond du cœur, MERCI. Merci pour le poulet. Merci pour les travaux. Quelle grâce.
注意！此游戏似乎是以主机体验为核心设计，之后再移植到PC平台。默认键位较反人类，且不支持超宽屏分辨率，在超宽屏上游玩时画面两侧会有黑边。

T L D R - Learn to dodge and parry to make combat make sense, there is not enough content to justify the price, and it's a cool glimpse into the 40k universe through the personalities of the characters. Also, the operations mode is fun and replayable, but the weapon progression system sucks.

It was refreshing but ironic to find authentic characters in peak fiction. The campaign story is just a glimpse into the grim dark of 40k, but more about the universe is revealed through the personalities of the fear incarnate warriors known as Space Marines and the machine cultists who assist them. Even though the story is short, through their dialogue and interactions you learn why the characters are motivated to continue existing in one of the bleakest, most depraved, and nightmarish universes ever conceived. No matter how bad things get, humanity keeps fighting back and life, uh, finds a way.

Operations mode multiplayer missions are fun, but the progression system is bad because by the time you start unlocking the higher weapons, you will be bored out of your gourd from doing the same mission(s) 40,000 times. You just unlock things far too long after your desire to grind expires for how repetetive the gameplay loop is.

There is way too little content in the launch week to justify the price of the game. I guess inflation does not only affect packages of bacon.

The tutorial is fun, but it did not adequately teach my inner ape how to use the dodge and parry mechanics. Once I learned how to frequently use dodge and parry to counterattack and stagger, the combat became more interesting and my survivability went up.

P.S. Why TF is the shield not attached to his arm? There are so many skull symbols, you could throw a dart at a Space Marine and it would hit 3 skulls while flying through the air. The armor is all cookie-cutter 'ultra good boy' Ultramarine and the cosmetics are super low effort. I can't even spell codax complient.

《星际战士2》：请告诉帝皇，我将为祂再次冲锋！并为此无悔！

9月9日忆战斗兄弟
独在异星屠异形，每逢佳节倍思亲。
遥知兄弟杀异端，遍砍头颅少一人。


要说9月，不少人最期待的游戏便是《战锤40k：星际战士2》了，前作《星际战士1》是十三年前的经典老游戏了，当时由Relic(水雷）制作。而《星际战士2》早已不是原先的开发团队，接手新作的制作组换成了Saber Interactive，他们比较出名的游戏便是以夸张的同屏僵尸数量著称的《僵尸世界大战》。
Saber Interactive所呈现的壮恢弘场景的画面配上全新引擎特效，无疑使本作成为战锤系列粉丝所能够体验到的迄今为止工业水平最高的游戏。
但非战锤系列粉丝，这款游戏不一定适合你。
首先是网络问题，本作的线上联机对外国玩家影响不大（这服务器问题估计一时半会改不了），但大部分国内玩家要开加速器才能稳定联机，如果你平时不常用加速器，就需要斟酌一下是否购买。
其次本作并不是一款无双割草游戏，如果你是想体验在虫海中一夫当关,万夫莫开，那可能有点难，本作PVE部分实际体验下来更偏向战术跟操作。

本作的玩法分为战役，PVE,PVP三个板块，我个人游玩了30多个小时，战役已通关，PVE已毕业一个角色，至于PVP，我个人对于竞技玩法不感冒就没玩。
先夸一下本作的战役玩法，战役游玩时间大概在7到8小时左右，游戏的前半段我们将面对遮天蔽日的泰坦虫族，后半段则是对上混沌星际战士军团“千疮之子”，最后2章的演出更是顶级！无论是画面演出，剧情走向，对于战锤系列粉丝都是一盘大餐。
（战役是没有收益的，但还是推荐先玩战役再玩PVE，可以获得最佳的剧情体验）
接着是“行动”，也就是PVE部分，PVE的任务关卡其实就是战役剧情的另一个视角，所以6个关卡基本还是战役的那几张图。
PVE可以选择6哥不同的兵种（职业），各有特色。
例如战术兵可提供高额的增伤扫描BUFF，突击兵（最菜职业）能凭借强大的机动性突入虫群（高难度上去送），先锋兵的钩锁可直接“切后排”攻击敌方的远程单位，重装兵则有着为团队提供更强生存能力的团体技能，本身坦度也不俗。
狙击兵能在战场后方利用高伤武器处理掉棘手敌人，还有着强力的隐身技能保护自己，而最后的特战兵是强力的移动炮台，可以倾泻出强大的火力。
完成PVE的关卡便能获得经验用来升级角色，角色升级后可以获得天赋点进一步特化职业特色跟强度，毕业一个角色大约要花费20到30多个小时。
另外不同的兵种还能使用三种不同的主，副，近战武器，，武器熟练度也需要肝，也都是独立的。比如你肝出来的满级武器，这个职业不适配，就得重新杀怪肝熟练度，熟练度升满后还要用金币＋武器数据解锁武器升级接着肝。
外观部件也需要肝，而且绝大数外观基本是换色皮，太肝了这个系统。
关卡也没啥随机元素，除了部分资源跟武器数据刷新的点不一样，偶尔会刷新出特种敌人跟BOSS，每次游玩的体验都大体相同，而且为了追求效率，目前版本大部分玩家只会刷1图跟2图，多刷几次真的很容易腻。
再来说说战斗系统，游戏采用了远近兼具的动作系统，同时还有闪避，格挡，处决等元素。
敌人发动蓝光攻击角色可以使用格挡招架（非蓝光也能档，但无法触发枪袭），发动红光攻击则要翻滚闪避，无论是闪避还是招架，只要完美触发了时机，便能直接秒杀小怪回复护甲，精英敌人则会施加一个红色瞄准印记，此时我们按下射击键便可进行一次“枪袭”造成大量伤害并回复护甲（小怪被打出失衡状态也能枪袭）。
敌人被打至残血后还能进行处决，游戏中每种怪物都有多种独特的处决动作，此外每一个处决动作都充满了番茄酱四溅的场面，展现出一种独特的暴力美学。
远程部分目前平衡一塌糊涂，版本主流武器是“热熔枪”，跟其他武器不是一个强度的（狙击武器跟榴弹伤害也还行），这武器不只伤害高，它一发还能把精英怪打出硬直，自带高穿透直接一发能打一群怪，另外残血了还能“吸血”电表倒转直接满血，能用“热熔枪"的职业天生高人一等。
近战系统倒是挺有趣的，每把武器都能通过轻重组合打出不同的连招派生，但近战很难打出硬直，高难度下被精英包围用近战很容易“猝死”，导致高难度近战又没啥存在感。
可以说游戏的PVE模式，目前实在是不尽人意，武器平衡稀烂，地图新鲜感不足，养成方面很肝，但又没有自由组合BD的爽感。

《战锤40k：星际战士2》总体而言还是瑕不掩瑜，战役模式大场景及气氛渲染到位，顶级演出，情绪价值拉满，加入的中文配音更是沉浸感拉满。
但PVE模式目前糟糕的土豆服务器，武器平衡稀烂，地图过少，养成玩法毫无深度，游玩20到30小时就令人感到乏味。
好在制作组画了不少“饼",更新计划表都安排到了明年2025年了，还是可以期待一下的，毕竟他们之前做的僵尸世界大战也是不断更新了好多新内容口碑才慢慢变好的，所以我觉得可以期待一下后续的更新。

I am amending this review from Negative to Positive. Patch 3.0 addressed many grievances I had with the Chaos faction, as well as how armor is handled. While I still feel the bolters in particular are unsatisfying to use in general, and I think ranged weapon TTKs could stand to be sped up for the sake of gamefeel (with enemy spawns being boosted to compensate), the game is now in a good enough state that I feel I can recommend it.

To put it simple: This Game is beyond amazing.
To get into more detail, you have:

- a game made for 40k fans with respect and love for the community
- the continuation of an old story aswell as an entirely new one, packaged together in the best way possible
- a graphical and performence peek even on minimum requirements
- a fun experience both pvp and pve with 6 unique classes to play as
- gameplay that is easy to learn but hard to master, with 4 difficulties to choose from for both pve and the campaign (aswell as a 5. on the horizon)
- a grind to sink your teeth in for cosmetics aswell as endgame perks and weapon upgrades that keeps you busy for hours
- no microtransactions whatsoever
- Free gameplay contant up and coming till mid 2025
- a completely optional season pass only including cosmetics and drip

and not to forget,

- living the dream of beeing one of the emperors chosen, a powerfull angle of death figthing against the horrors of the galaxy

Bardzo dobra gra w imię Boga Imperatora. Przepotężna rzeźnia heretyckiego plugastwa i abominacji - flaki walają się wszędzie. Można też wydobyć ich jeszcze więcej, z pomocą miecza łańcuchowego, młota energetycznego czy bolterów. Astartes są potężni i to czuć oraz widać na każdym kroku. Niszczenie robactwa to czysta rozkosz, wykończenia są świetne i mega satysfakcjonujące. Graficznie gra też wygląda cudownie, momentami musiałem przystopować z misją żeby popodziwiać widoki. 12 godzin rozgrywki i nie miałem żadnego crasha, problemów z teksturami, czy czymkolwiek innym. Grę instalujesz, odpalasz i śmiga bez problemu, co teraz jest niestety rzadkością przy większości nowych tytułów. Cudowna jatka z wciągająca i trzymającą się kupy fabułą.

Game is fun. Sadly after the Hotfix on release my game just constantly crashes on startup after the first Warning Screen.
The Problem seems to be the Intel I9 Series, that just doesn't work with the game currently..

I have tried everything to fix it. Trust me EVERYTHING. Even wrote .bat in the Game files scripts.
As long as i can't play the Game it sadly gets a negativ review.

Edit:

I found the resolution. Just gotta install Intel extreme Tuning Utility and set the Performance Core Ratio from 56x to 52x. After that it worked fine for me!! finaly i can die again FOR THE EMPEROR!

Game is good, but has room for some extra polish or optimizations.

The story is a good power trip where the content feels challenging but you have the tools to do it. Some of the gimmicks wear themselves thin, even more so as a solo or duo where you have to trust the bots to deal the main damage over yourself (such as ripper segments). Thankfully these segments are few and far between. PVP is also fun with 6v6 matches and is enjoyable even though the modes are pretty basic.

My biggest complaint right now is the fact PVP map pool is only 3 maps. The road map indicates a new map in 2025 but that means 3+ months grinding on only the current small pool. This and the slow pace of unlocking gear in PVP, I can see being a point of burnout for people. Also PVP matches really need to shuffle teams as two three mans can queue snipe each other to doom stack a lobby. Just general flow around menuing for PVP is also kinda clunky between the amount of load screens and waiting. For instance you can't edit your loadout in match, you must finish your game, then load into your battle barge, go to the armory and wait for the robo boy to slowly come down all while a timer ticks for the next match. To the point why even bother loading into the barge when all of this could just be menus you can flip through post match. And on the point of load screens god they are a pain. I know I don't have the best computer but even my friends are faster rigs have long load times just getting in and connected

Once again, Steam could use a 'maybe' category for recommendation. This game looks and sounds beautiful. Enemies and NPCs look lore accurate, and for the most part act lore accurate, in a great way. The campaign is relatively short for the price however, and I'm really not interested in the multiplayer aspect at all.

That said, the single player would be improved greatly if the bot teammate AI was just a little better, or had a Mass Effect style order system, or even a priority target list you could set, to control where the bots focus their shooting and melee. Way too many times, the bots shoot at trash mobs, or even the small rat mobs that their guns won't even effect, instead of flying buffer enemies or any sort of real threats. They will also sometimes just lock up, seemingly overwhelmed by the sheer number of enemies running around.

Also, on Veteran difficulty and above, the guns feel ridiculously weak. You can empty your entire ammo supply, not just magazines, into some enemies and barely move their health bar, even with headshots. Also, whenever most enemies, even some borderline trash mobs die, they enter a flashing red 'Execute' state, which is useful for regaining armor in theory but less useful when dozens of them are in that state all over the map, and your AI teammates ignore them and let them heal up and reenter the fight.

The game also suffers from a DOOM style 'only one attack pattern matters' vs certain enemies, aka the dual sword wielding Tyranids, for example. If you don't counter their melee hit and then shoot them with the pistol (when a quicktime style indicator pops up), you are literally wasting time and ammo, and their 20 friends are jump stabbing you in the face and back.

The animations for melee attacks are also simply too slow, you can perfectly counter a literal half dozen swarmer enemies and kill them, and then get hit and damaged while STILL DOING the attack animation from another angle. Either make the animations WAY faster, or give some iframes in there, for playability.

The heavy bolter(full auto heavy weapon one) is great. What's not great however, is the fact that it counts as a fire and discard weapon, aka it cannot be reloaded from the many, many suspiciously placed ammo boxes all over enemy territory. That leads to another point, these are the least equipped space marines ever. Three person squads (for balance reasons according to the developers), with no medpacks on deployment, only 2-4 magazines, and a melee weapon? Also I've only had a jetpack once out of what seems to be 90% of the game so far, and no heavy weapon Space Marine squads are in sight. Only non-controllable vehicles in cut scenes.

This probably sounds overly negative, but the game is SO close to being amazing. Just better AI, more Ammo (for my shooty space marines), better kit selection before missions(medpacks, more ammo, grenade types, a heavy weapon, etc.) and it's an all time great game. It certainly looks and sounds like it already. Just a few numbers patches, or maybe eventually modders will save it.

If you play solo, look forward to rage against the braindead teammate AI, but it's probably a great game with a focused team of 3 human players.

Also, vs some of the large boss enemies, in particular Carnifex and the flying shielded caster thing... does my super mutant cyborg really take 3+ seconds to pick up a box of ammo or grenades? You are going to need to shoot these guys THOUSANDS of times, so you must scrounge ammo, and stopping to actually pick it up gets you swarmed by trash and unblockable boss attacks.

Somehow I suspect the developers won't do most of the changes I'm looking for, as this game has already sold very well. Hopefully some modders see it close to my way though!

Я не являюсь фанатом вселенной Warhammer, играл серию Vermintide и несколько часов поиграл в прошлую Space Marine (аж 13 лет назад!) мне первая часть вообще не понравилась, и на фоне других проектов того времени была серой, скучной, однообразной, что игру бросил. И вот выходит вторая часть и судя по оценкам и обзорам, большинство просто в восторге от нее. Я подсел на всеобщий хайп и купил игру, и вот пройдя ее полностью готов поделиться своим мнением, которое неоднозначное. Начинается все довольно бодро, масштабно и очень красиво, графика тут прям хороша, у тебя складывается ощущение, что ты играешь не побоюсь сравнения в DOOM от третьего лица, также море кровищи, зрелищные фаталити над оглушенными врагами и все в этом роде, потом ловишь себя на мысли, да нет это же космический Gears of War, только пила у тебя теперь не на пушке, а вшита в меч. Игра тебя несколько часов удивляет своим постоянным экшеном и ты думаешь ДА это определенно экшен года, но чем дальше продвигаешься по сюжету, тем больше играешь уже с ленцой, потому что сюжет очень простенький, этакий фильмец категории Б, враги одинаковые, вот просто CTRL+C CTRL+V, их реально всего 4-5 видов, это простые мобы жуки, потом жуки побольше, потом еретики дрищи и еретики побольше, ну и пара солдат, тоже из разряда ONE KILL. И со временем этот однообразный геймплей жутко утомляет, потому что игровые ситуации все одинаковые, получили задание от тупого (об этом дальше) командира, полетели, высадились и стрельба бесконечная с одинаковыми врагами. Командир затылок еще тот, то есть ваш командир, не главный герой. Ситуация - ГГ говорит мне нужно два отряда, командир отвечает - могу дать шестерых солдат, ну ок. Следующая миссия ГГ просит 6 солдат, командир отвечает могу дать трех. Проходит всего ёптер мать один час и командир говорит - я отправил туда то туда то два отряда, то есть отправляет собака такая, а тебе шиш с маслом. Дальше больше, твои напарники это те еще два тела, в одной миссии у одного из них на почве мести засвистела фляга, ну дали ему в тык и привели в чувство, следующая миссия, засвистела фляга у другого (он мне кстати вообще не понравился как персонаж и бесил всю игру), опять дали в тык и окей. Ну тупых ситуаций и ребячества в этой игре хватает. Битвы с боссами неинтересные и однотипные, только финальный босс хоть как то порадовал. Ну вот и всё. В целом, если играть в игру просто по паре часов в день, чтобы расслабиться, она идеально подходит, олдскульная, брутальная стрелялка от третьего лица, реально не думал, что после многих кинематографических игр за эти годы, мы будем рады таким играм, которые до нельзя примитивные, красивые, но простые и звезд с неба не хватают. Все потому, что сейчас упор на онлайн, на донат, на игры сервисы и различные культуры, которые не будем затрагивать в этом обзоре, вот на фоне всего этого Space Marine 2 отдушина. Играть или не играть решит каждый сам, я вот подсел на хайп и не сказать, что пожалел, игра хорошая, но под конец утомляет и с простым сюжетом. Оценка 7.5 баллов, есть затравка на следующую часть, но разработчикам нужно постараться в плане истории и разнообразия.

Product received for free

Imagine ser um Space Marine, uma máquina de guerra geneticamente modificada que mistura o Hulk com o Robocop, só que com mais músculos, menos remorso e a capacidade de fazer buracos gigantes em qualquer coisa que ouse existir na sua frente. Agora, adicione um universo onde todo mundo está basicamente tendo o pior dia da sua vida todos os dias, e pronto, você tem Warhammer 40k: Space Marine 2.

Neste jogo, você é Titus, o Space Marine que já gastou todas as suas férias e está eternamente preso em um ciclo de violência, mas ele nunca reclama, porque reclamar é para os fracos. Seu trabalho? Simples: sobreviver a hordas de alienígenas, demônios e qualquer outra coisa que o universo cuspa na sua direção. Se você acha que isso soa um pouco estressante, relaxe — Titus não tem tempo para esses sentimentos. Seu único hobby é explodir inimigos com armas que fazem as metralhadoras convencionais parecerem brinquedos de criança.

Os gráficos são tão detalhados que dá pra ver os músculos das suas veias — sim, seus músculos têm veias próprias, é assim que os Space Marines rolam. A quantidade de sangue e tripas por pixel é insana, o que faz você se perguntar: “Será que eles têm um departamento de limpeza nos planetas imperiais?”. Porque sério, o lugar fica uma zona toda vez que você aparece.

A jogabilidade? Simplesmente perfeita se você gosta de avançar sem pensar, explodir coisas e gritar "PORQUE O IMPERADOR PEDE!" a cada cinco minutos. Seus oponentes vão de “ah, isso foi fácil” para “espera, isso é uma onda infinita de inimigos?”. E tudo isso enquanto você está basicamente fazendo crossfit com armadura e armas que pesam tanto quanto um carro.

Em suma, é como pegar um blockbuster de ação dos anos 80, misturar com ficção científica hardcore e dar a tudo uma dose de esteróides. Se você já sonhou em resolver todos os problemas do universo com uma serra elétrica gigante, este é o jogo para você. E lembre-se: no futuro sombrio do 41º milênio, não há tempo para terapia... só para carnificina.

E no final das contas, quando você é esmagado por um Tiranídeo gigantesco, há uma satisfação estranha em gritar com orgulho: "PELO IMPERADOR!"

After reading the negative reviews and assessing their statements, I have decided I should write a review.
One of the biggest complaints I saw was people complaining that the 2 highest difficulties of the campaign "Require" Co-Op. Whether it was because missions were hard, the AI was incompetent, or enemies took too many bullets to kill, requiring you to use a "Janky" melee system. I beat the campaign on the highest difficulty solo; one of my friends beat the campaign solo on that difficulty as well. News flash. A co-op game is usually balanced around playing co-op with either friends or other people.
The second complaint I saw was the game being "stiff" or "unresponsive" and the combat being janky. The combat is supposed to feel slow. Poorly timed dodges and parries are punished. Spamming attacks are supposed to be unrewarding at best and punished at worst. People kept mentioning that they can't cancel a dodge. I didn't even know that was a normal feature in games. Usually you press the button, action happens, and then you resume. Sometimes games will let you "Cancel" something if it's a long action like a reload or mantling a ledge.
PVP isn't super unbalanced. There are some tweaks that need to be made, but on the whole it's enjoyable as long as your teammates realize this isn't a normal shooter. It's more akin to CS or Valorant. You want to play with your team and play Objectives. A solo player can pop off, but more often than not, a solo player gets caught out and killed quickly.
To the people who are saying this is another "short life" game because it has low re-playability. Unlike a lot of other games that are trying to be in this space, it has a road map. We know what's coming and when to expect it. Thats more than I can say for a lot of games like this.

To wrap it all in a nice bow. Remember, other games exist. Go play them.

I've played a couple other Warhammer games before but this one so far is my favorite. Great story and the multiplayer is fun and challenging! Haven't tried PVP but from what i can tell the ttk is in a nice spot and can add some more life to the game. If the Devs can keep a steady stream of content then i can see this game doing really well. If not, for those who seek a more PVE style of game play, they might burn out pretty quick due to the repetitious nature of the multiplayer operations, even though the enemies are procedural (kinda), the mission objectives can get a little stale. However, the progression system and different classes help for those who seek to grind like i do, i can see myself easily putting 100+ hours chasing those levels and gear. Lastly, the campaign took me about 8 hours on normal and that's with exploring every nook for hidden data pads on normal but by the end you'll be shouting "FOR THE EMPEROR!"

На мой взгляд игра шикарная.

Боёвка брутальная, много как ХтХ, так и пострелушек, в зависимости от того, с чем бегаешь (и каким классом, если говорить про операции/PvP).
Завезли систему уклонений и парирований атак, после которых можно бесплатный болт противнику в лоб прописать (даже если патроны кончились – потому что Император помогает).
Пушек приличное количество – в основном болтеры разных видов, но есть ещё мельты, плазмы, снайперская лазпушка, несколько видов оружия ближнего боя.

В основной кампании куча всяких крутых постановочных штук как для тех, кто хотя бы немного увлекается настолкой, так и для незнакомых с вахой полностью – сюжет хоть и простенький, но антураж эпичный.
Игра имеет связь с первой частью, но и без прохождения первой части всё равно всё будет понятно, за исключением пары нюансов.
Места действия меняются постоянно – тропические леса, заводы механикус, готишный город-улей, мрачная планета-гробница (натурально планета, которую используют чисто чтобы народ хоронить) и ещё более мрачные подземелья этой планеты.
Кампанию можно проходить соло или в коопе до трёх человек.

Плюс есть чисто коопный режим на троих, события в котором разворачиваются параллельно тем событиям, которые происходят в основной кампании и с этими событиями непосредственно связаны.
В этом режиме можно гонять за десов шести разных классов из любого ордена первого основания, ЧХ, ДС, неизвестного основания, кучку саксессоров Ультрамаринов и любой орден, который ты сам сможешь собрать из доступных красок/лекал. Даже символику предателей завезли.
Кастомизировать можно не только броню, но и снарягу – как в плане внешнего вида, так и в плане характеристик. В наличии прокачка самих классов, которая позволяет открывать всякие персональные и командные перки.
Операций всего шесть, но обещают в будущем больше добавить. В целом, как минимум несколько раз их пройти будет интересно, на разных сложностях и разными классами, т.к. там врагов на тебя разными дозами выкидывает "режиссёр".

Мультиплеер простенький. Я не фанат PvP, так что мало что могу про него сказать. В наличии три режима: командный десмач, контроль территории и контроль точек.

Бывают проблемы с соединением – после релиза для всех их стало меньше, вроде.
Сегодня катч вышел, после него весь вечер никаких проблем с коннектом не было.

Кишко-образные локации начиненные противниками разной степени впитываемости урона, подбираемое оружие на локации, сегменты где ну... обязательно надо что-то оборонять, сtrl c+ctrl v и игра готова.

Из-за этого в битве ощущениe по типу НЫА НА БЛЯTЬ НА НА ХYЙ УМРИ Я EБAНУТЫЙ. Импакт в игре хорош, звуки бахают и трахают, количеством крови на экране можно перекрасить черное море в красное, космодёсны орут что есть мощи в пылу битвы, вообщем шик.

Kötelező darab konkrétan mindenkinek aki szereti magát a Warhammer világát főleg , de aki 1 tartalmas játékra vágyik és a mindennapi stresszt kívánja levezetni 1 gyors kikapcsoló darálással annak is érdemes ránéznie. Nem fog csalódni .....

Kampány kicsit rövid , de tartalmas mindamellett Co-op ban is kitolható másik 2 haverral , és ha kivégeztétek a fő szálat akkor jön a lényeg merthogy a kampány az igazából csak a bemelegítés kedvcsináló ha úgy tetszik.

Co-op küldik van a játéknak 1 része amit a Warhammer 40k Darktide hoz tudnék legjobban hasonlítani csak Space Marinokkal. 6 különálló kaszt szintezhető, testre szabható mind külsőleg mind belsőleg jelenleg 6 különböző pályán, és külön nehézségi fokozatokon 3 fős csapatokban. Nem mellesleg van a játékban PC-konzol crossplatform

PVP Része a játéknak kicsit unbalanced és ebben a modeban csak külsőre szabhatod testre karaktered sajnos és itt nincs crossplatform . Sokat nem játszottam vele , talán nincs még úgy kiforrva mint az 1. részben.

Valamint az összes fontosabb tartalom ingyenes lesz. A szesonpass kizárólag kozmetikai elemeket fog tartalmazni . Amit viszont a year one battleplan nem tartalmaz az az , hogy a fejlesztők nyitottak az új kasztok felé is és ehhez a közösség ötleteit várják aminek személy szerint nagyon örülök , de ez mellett új mappok új pvp mappok , ellenségek game modok várhatóak teljesen ingyen !

«Сожги еретика, убей мутанта, преследуй нечисть. Мы врываемся в самую гущу боя. Мы не отсиживаемся за укрытиями, мы всегда идем в атаку! Да устрашатся нас враги наши, ибо мы — гнев Императора! За Императора! За Империум человечества!»

— Призыв Ультрамаринов

I have been hoping for a sequel for space marine for 11 years, I have been waiting for this to release for 2 years. Does it deliver? I will explain below, starting with the campaign, then the MP modes ending on the technical details and overall thoughts.

Campaign


Space Marine 2 puts you into the armour of a Space Marine 40.000 years into the future. A genetically engineered super soldier that is 3 metres tall, a space marine is almost indestructible, they are faster and stronger than any normal human and some of them can be hundreds of years old. They are wrapped in myth and legend and are skilled warriors beyond measure. They are a bulwark against terror in a universe that has known only war for centuries.

Humanity is fighting against horrors beyond their comprehension and while there are several factions of said horrors, the main one we're dealing with here, is a Tyranid Hive fleet.
Tyranids are a bug/lizard like faction that swarm the universe to consume biomass, they evolve at an incredibly fast rate and can counter almost any known weapon or biological agent known to mankind and speed is of the essence when dealing with them. A planet attacked by them never truly recovers and there are millions and millions gunning for you.

The story picks up quite some time after Space Marine 1, and you are Titus. While I won't go into much story detail. The tutorial and thus the introduction to Space Marine 2, immediately shows what stakes you're up against and sets the tone for the entire campaign.

The campaign is a great introduction to some of the scale that Warhammer 40K offers and its bleak hopeless setting, there is only war and it shows. The campaign is filled with gigantic set pieces, wild lush alien forests and jungles, gigantic cities with massive cathedrals or abandoned bunkers and dark secrets. Everywhere you see signs of the carnage that happens all around you and the grimdark setting that 40K invented really shines here.

Gameplay wise the game is reminiscent of Space Marine 1, just improved upon. combat is fast and diverse and the game expects you to switch tactics on the fly.

As a space marine you have a great arsenal of weapons to use, from the infamous Bolt weapons, massive assault weapons that fire a bolt, a massive rocket propelled round that embeds itself in the target and detonates, to melta guns, plasma guns, heavy bolters. But you also have several melee weapons, from the Chainsword, to the Thunderhammer. Why? because the combat in this games switches between thinning out hordes and hordes of enemies before they reach you and then turns into a hack and slash brawler fest.

The combat is incredibly dynamic and it keeps you on your toes especially on higher difficulties. Luckily you are not alone in this rigorous slaughter fest. Titus has two other space marines with him, which can either be controlled by your friends or the computer. While the bots lack some finesse and tend to focus on direct threats, they are a welcome addition. Just don't expect too much of them, they are bots. they beeline for you to get you up if you're down but not out and they can distract some enemies.

The campaign will take you around 10 to 12 hours to complete and my time with it was enjoyed very much, I had several "Holy sh!t" moments and I felt like a space marine, the story is all I hoped for after 13 years and I loved it.


The multiplayer is the other part of Space Marine 2. It can be separated in two parts: PVE and PVP.


PVE is one of the parts that shines here, during the campaign several squads often help Titus with secondary objectives, the PVE or Operations gives you control of these squads. You can run this with up to two of your friends or bots, but trust me, play with friends.

You have six classes with each of them having a distinct role, weapon set and main ability.
From the standard space marine with bolter and chainsword, to the bulwark with shield and sword to a stealthy sniper

Each class has weapon upgrades, perks for the weapons and the class itself and customisation to unlock.
Yes you can create your very own space marine or unlock several other space marine chapters and customise those and while the customisation needs some polish, it's incredibly varied.

There are currently six operations most of which coincide with the campaign, they can take 30 to 45 minutes to complete and on higher difficulties they require coordination, tactics and sharing of resources.

They often feel like mini raids and they are incredibly fun to do, however in contrast to games such as Darktide I wonder how fun these missions stay, they feel less like a horde shooter and more like a mini campaign, while enemy variety and objectives can switch around in an operation, I feel it might get repetitive. Yet they are like I said incredibly fun and I will probably keep coming back to them, just because of the gameplay loop.


The second MP mode is Eternal War, a 6v6 PVP mode with the same classes as the Operations mode, just different progression. There three modes, King of the Hill, Seize ground (several points to capture) and Annihilation (team death match) and as of writing 3 maps.

The gameplay in pvp is great, classes are diverse and while some balancing might be happening it is incredibly fun to play despite it's lack of maps and modes. I spend several hours playing this and the tactical aspect in it is really fun, it isn't just run and gun, you have to counter other classes, bullwarks can block damage, snipers sneak around, assault's jump in to cut you down. There are tons of cool skirmishes to be found and it's an absolute blast.

However it's also the most bare bones part of the game. While the customisation for space marines is great, the chaos marines lack customisation, every class is attached to a traitor legion and is thus bound to it. You cannot play an iron warrior vanguard for instance and the armor itself is barely customisable, sometimes even not. For some of the more chaos minded players this can be quite a big letdown.

The other issue is that while it is 6v6 I can only make a lobby with three people, not six or four, locking out some of my friends to play with, I get it for PVE, I don't for PVP.

PVP feels like something added later in development and I hope that the devs do expand upon it with some much needed Quality of Life changes.


The game is quite CPU heavy, I have a i9-10850k CPU and a RTX4070 TI SUPER, the game runs like a charm in 90% of the game, but some areas and missions are incredible heavy on the CPU so much I wonder if it's a bit of optimalisation. Some area's that are small tank my frames, while some large open areas I run at a solid 80 FPS on ultra settings.

Besides that though, the game is beautiful to look at and effects, lighting, textures are all incredibly impressive, from the sparks of a broken cable to the blood that flies around.

The sound design is really well done and weapon sounds pack the punch you expect them to, every bolt fired, every enemy screech, every punch thrown is of high quality and this combined with the graphical design makes this a very immersive 40K game.


Despite some personal gripes and an in my opinion a bare bones PVP, this game has been worth the wait, it build upon the foundation of Space Marine 1 and improved it immensely. It offers something for older fans and something for newer fans of 40K and it is an incredible home-coming or introduction to the Space Marine franchise and thus Warhammer 40.000. It's an incredibly brutal, fun third person action game and the gameplay loop is quite addicting.

Sabre shows it understands 40K and this game is an ode to it.

Campaign 10/10
PVE: 9/10
PVP 8/10
Graphics 9/10
Sound 9/10

Overall: 9/10

Campaign: one of the best I've played in recent memory - this is the only part I can recommend
PvE: repetitive and loses steam after about 3 runs of each map
PvP: not my jam, no opinion, have not played

Overall the combat and general gameplay is some of the most satisfying I've seen since something like Gears but without all the cover nonsense and the first run of the campaign has some real jaw dropping moments in both visuals and reveals.

However, if you're looking for more than the campaign, this is hard to recommend. Much like Left 4 Dead, Back 4 Blood, World War Z, Darktide, etc, there's just nothing to do in the PvE Operations mode except grind out cosmetics and passives. That might be enough for some, but it lacks any of the systems that make something like Destiny, Warframe, Deep Rock Galactic, Remnant, or the plethora of other rougelikes out there that do so much with mapgen and other secondary systems that make each run feel like a run, not just going through the same motions again. I'm never excited by anything that's gonna drop from a mission, it's just "cross the finish line this many times" for your next passive/cosmetic.

Cosmetics are awesome, classes are fine, progression kinda sucks since you only unlock one row at a time. Not sure I'll be playing long enough to max a single class despite only playing two of them. Passives are... there? They all feel like relatively minor gameplay bonuses that help steer your playstyle, but not one so far has made me excited to unlock or feel it was worth working towards. They feel more like bypasses to some inconvenince rather than some Astartes-level power. I don't think I'd be able to tell an endgame level build from an early game one from gameplay alone.

Would be awesome if in new game + you could play the campaign with your custom marine so 60% of the PvE missions were playable with the PvE classes. I think that's my biggest issue, the best PvE content isn't what you get to replay for progression and what's there to replay gets stale fast. Really hope to see some updates to the operations modes that make them more fun to replay. Modifiers, loot drops that persist after a play session, consumable buffs, unique mission rewards, map variants, mapgen, really anything except playing the same mission over and over with some different combat pacing each time.

If campaigns are your jam, pick it up on sale. If you wanted something more replayable, wait.
